Sparknotes.CONTENT: As the creatures bore down on the party, the Maluma nearly falls from the cliffs before lashing out from Nightingale’s palms and devouring them. Even though Nightingale suffered a nasty cut, the Maluma seemed unphased by the pain. Instead, it looks nervous from the close call with death from falling.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STRUGGLING TO GET THERE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Seeing it’s nervousness for the first time, Rook can’t help but wonder that the Maluma would have nowhere to go if it died in a body that fell that distance. Perhaps the Great Bounty would claim it after all?

Sparknotes.TITLE: THANKS ANYWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THANKS ANYWAY

Sparknotes.TITLE: THANKS ANYWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With the last of their attackers either fleeing or dead on the ground, they are free to assess the damage. Padric walks slowly between them, unable to completely restrain his hope that someone had managed to find his shotgun. But of course, they didn’t. It was lost.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THANKS ANYWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric thanks them all for their help, even if they failed to find his shotgun. Padric promises a reward of sorts regardless and the group returns safely to Rhamsted.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THANKS ANYWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Padric offers a discount for your help.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group is dragged to the Rhamsted palace in irons.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: When they arrive, they find Malik and Grace together in the throne room. Grace chastises the guards for locking up royalty and has the irons removed before apologizing to Zeke.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Malik and Grace demand an explanation as they have eye witness accounts that the five of them were seen leaving the murder scene in flames. Zeke quickly defends their actions, telling them that it wasn’t them. He points the finger at Aisling, explaining that she was torching the place to hide evidence and cover her tracks.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi also backs the story up, angrily condemning her father for using Melody as a deterrent for others who might attempt to break in.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Malik and Grace seem relieved to hear that they weren’t the ones destroying evidence. But the relief is quickly replaced with anger at the realization that Aisling is the one behind the murder.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Malik and Grace argue over what to do about Aisling and the group learns that Malik had warned Grace long ago about Aisling being hell bent on revenge. Apparently, Grace hadn’t taken him seriously and no action was taken the first time she was warned by Malik.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Their open display of teamwork shows Padric that Aisling was probably right the whole time, these two were in league. Padric makes a snide comment to Grace about letting someone like Malik in on such official business. Grace only threatens him, making it clear that his friendship with Shayliss is the only reason Padric’s still able to run his mouth the way he does. Furthermore, Grace promises that if he intervenes with their pursuit of Aisling that Grace will have him tried all the same.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric is rudely dismissed. He bows respectfully to Grace before leaving, making sure to make eye contact with Nightingale before finally leaving the throne room.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE GRACE OF RHAMSTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Grace and Malik decide to take action against Aisling while keeping Nightingale and her friends away from causing anymore trouble. Nightingale, Remi, Zeke and Rook all protest, claiming there is a bigger threat that needs to be taken care of but Grace has none of it. She tells them that they’ll be staying in the castle until Balthazar comes to fetch them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Defeated, Nightingale slumps against the wall as the monster woman advances on her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi yells, trying to distract the monster before it can kill Nightingale. The monster woman turns on Remi and bears down on her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: In a moment of desperation, Nightingale is coerced by the Maluma into giving up her body to save Remi’s life. With her friend screaming and in danger, Nightingale sees no alternative and accepts the Maluma’s offer.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma takes ahold of Nightingale’s body and ushers in incredible strength. Nightingale is controlled like a puppet as a horrific maw opens from her palms and spits forth a wave of grotesque mouths. Only moments away from making a killing blow against Remi, the monster woman is caught in the multitude of mouths and thrashed about, suffering grievous damage to her body.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The monster woman screams and backs away in fear as the Maluma looms above her with a wide maw. Feeling the Maluma’s malicious intent on consuming the woman whole, Nightingale fights with all of her might to force the Maluma back inside of her palms. Nightingale is able to regain control as the Maluma disappears, it’s massive mouth snapping and raging as it’s sucked back into her palms.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: True to its word, the Maluma let her have her body back… or was it it Nightingale that forced the Maluma back inside of her? Nightingale isn’t sure, but regardless, Remi is safe, the monster Woman is incapacitated and Nightingale feels pretty good about herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE ONE THAT GOT AWAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag & Reward: Slipping. Nightingale’s encounter with the Maluma learns her a new Discipline.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: In distress and panicking, Remi sprints out of the cave. To Remi’s relief, her friends have come for her. Zeke catches her before she can fall to the ground from exhaustion and pain.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi screams out a warning as Aisling comes sprinting out of the cave just behind her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling skids to a stop, frozen in surprise that the group was able to find her hideout. In, one hand she holds the Hegemonix and there is no mistaking the power radiating from the artifact.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling curses at Padric, thinking he has betrayed her by helping the group find her hideout.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric tries to talk sense into Aisling, but it does no good.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling knows she cant bring her father back, but she can honor him by bringing justice to those who wronged him. By punishing those responsible, Aisling is only taking what’s rightfully hers. Kidnapping Remi and stealing her away from Malik would force him to feel loss, just like she had.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before the verbal fight can escalate any further, the Maluma cuts them both off with a shrill laugh. Using Nightingale’s body, it shoves Remi down into the dirt and mud.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Hurt and confused, Remi watches as Nightingale joins Aisling’s side. Emulating Nightingale, the Maluma claims that she too cares about Elenia and bringing justice to Malik and Grace. Nightingale promises Aisling that they shall both have what’s rightfully theirs.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Believing that the Princess of Elenia has her back, Aisling gears up for a fight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke curses at the Maluma, calling it a liar. Then he explains to Remi that the Maluma is in control.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale laughs as a sort of organic armor latches to her body. The Maluma forges a weapon made from the biology of it’s own sick body. It forms a grotesque sword and a set of armor that engulfs Nightingale. Then, without any further discussion, the Maluma and Aisling charge forward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook yells out, instructing that nobody hurts the Princess. Rook knows that the Maluma is looking for a new body and he won’t be tricked.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PERPETRATOR’S HIDEOUT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With a renewed strength and purpose, Remi picks herself up and draws her daggers. She wasn’t going to let Aisling or the Maluma hurt her friends.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE SHORTEST PATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE SHORTEST PATH

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE SHORTEST PATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Staying safe by sticking to the road takes the group on a hot walk beneath refreshing shade. After sometime, Nightingale hears a waterfall and Padric smiles knowing that his shotgun is close.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE SHORTEST PATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With advice to take it slow and be careful, Padric draws his weapon and the group follows suit, slowly advancing towards the waterfall.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO BROKE TO PLAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TOO BROKE TO PLAY

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO BROKE TO PLAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Charlotte berates the group for being too poor to play, seeing as how she’s heard that they’re royalty of sorts according to Padric.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO BROKE TO PLAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before Charlotte can make too much of a scene Padric steps in and offers to let them play for free.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: VICTORIOUS AISLING

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi collapses physically and emotionally from their defeat.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling taunts Remi, thinking that the youngest Princess of Elenia has her back. Aisling leans in close to Aisling and promises that she is going to take her back to Elenia and have her entire corrupt family punished for their crimes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling is suddenly struck in the back of the head by a vicious blow from Nightingale.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Controlled by the Maluma, Nightingale delivers a second horrible blow that sends Aisling crumpling to her knees.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Through her delirium, and unaware that Nightingale has been controlled by a parasite this whole time, Aisling is confused by her actions. She coughs blood and falls to the dirt.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi looks on in horror and confusion as the Maluma looms over Aisling.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric tries in vain to pull himself up in an attempt to stop Nightingale from delivering a fatal blow to Aisling.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale only laughs, taking the Hegemonix from the grass nearby Aisling. Nightingale clicks the puzzle box into place and unleashes the Exalted Esper inside.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS AISLING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling croaks out a warning in fear and pain. The Hegemonix was not to be trifled with and only Aisling truly knew what it would unleash.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE CLOSE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WE’RE CLOSE

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE CLOSE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook tosses the last dead Fragor from the cliffside, watching its body tumble far below.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE CLOSE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They ask the Maluma if they can have Nightingale back, but the Maluma claims that it promised them the murderer. Until then, Nightingale will stay under its control. The Maluma promises that they are almost upon the cave.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE CLOSE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Sure enough, the cave entrance was just ahead. It was a jagged wound in a cliff that was constantly bleeding rainwater.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE CLOSE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: To his surprise, Rook could just make out the outline of someone running towards the exit from within.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi slams into Aisling moments before she’s able to use the Hegemonix.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling goes sprawling and the Hegemonix goes over the cliffside.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi kicks off the ground and dives after it, narrowly catching the Hegemonix before crashing into the rocks below.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Unarmed and wounded, Aisling accepts defeat. Padric rushes to her side and comforts her. He quickly begins treating the terrible wounds she suffered from the fight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale thrashes in Rook’s arms. Remi approaches her, horrified that Nightingale did something so reckless to try and save her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi comforts Nightingale until the Maluma finally relinquished its hold and rolls back deep within her. The ordeal of clawing her own consciousness back to the surface of her psyche leaves Nightingale shaken. As she regains control of her body the organic armor and weapon vanish back inside of her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale sobs into Remi’s shoulder, shaken by the ordeal.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group moves back into the cave to take cover from the storm and enjoy a moment of respite. Once inside, Zeke goes through the bag that Remi took from Aisling. Luckily, the Information Broker did in fact find what they needed. There was details about a Theodotion user traveling with a cult called The Anointed. The group was last seen in the city of Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Excited, Rook explains that Hyde is only a couple days walk. If they left Rhamsted tonight, they’d cover that ground in no time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group agrees. And despite being locked in the tower by Grace, the events that had just transpired were important enough that Grace needed to know that they handled it. And in anycase, Remi wasn’t going to leave without making sure her father was alive and okay.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: But there was still one more issue to be resolved. Remi wasn’t going to let Aisling off the hook. Angry at what she’d been put through, Remi has little remorse for Aisling.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric on the other hand, seems to be more of an apologist, even going as far as trying to diffuse the situation all together. Remi angrily tells Padric that they should take her back to Malik and Grace and have them sort it out. It’s their city after all, and with the only thing Grace really cares about taken care of, she would have no reason to keep them locked up anymore.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling pleads. Claiming that she only fought them because she thought the Princess of Elenia had her back. Aisling worries that if they take her back to Grace that she wont get a fair trial and they’ll simply have her punished or even executed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric agrees. He doesn’t see taking Aisling back to Malik or Grace as a true form of justice. Instead, he recommends that they let him take Aisling to the capital of Elenia for a proper trial. That way, the Arsen and Jeong family can decide for themselves what needs to be done about the mess.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi still doesn’t like it. Moreover, she’s worried that any action against Aisling could put her father in real danger. King Balthazar didn’t have a reputation for being kind on criminals either. If they were all unlucky he’d have Aisling, Grace, and Malik executed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric doesn’t disagree, but he still stands by his plan. He wants to give Aisling a chance to explain herself to the King.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: It’s made clear that regardless of the decision, Remi, Rook, and Zeke feel that Grace and Malik should know what happened.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT TO DO WITH HER?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: The players must make a decision.

Sparknotes.TITLE: YOUR PLAN SUCKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: YOUR PLAN SUCKS

Sparknotes.TITLE: YOUR PLAN SUCKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Beaten back, the party hides nearby and regroups.

Sparknotes.TITLE: YOUR PLAN SUCKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke comes up with a plan and throws a rock to distract the creatures before darting forward towards the cave.

Sparknotes.TITLE: YOUR PLAN SUCKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: The noise from the stone distracts the monsters.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CHANGE IN PROFESSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A CHANGE IN PROFESSION

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CHANGE IN PROFESSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The young girl that the party saved in the mines approaches everyone and thanks them for saving her life. She wants to go adventuring with them but Damocles adamantly denies her. She gives them some loot for their troubles and vows to be a hero one day, just like they them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CHANGE IN PROFESSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Reward: The girl from the mines gives Damocles some loot.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A DISTRESS CALL

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While walking through the ash-ridden dreary town of Hyde. Rook’s amulet starts glowing, signifying that Suri wants to manifest. Worried that Suri must have some important information to share. Rook pulls off into a dilapidated building and gestures the others inside.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri suddenly appears. She exclaims that one of her Arkallan sisters is just outside the walls of Hyde and is in serious danger. She explains that a distress call such as this must be a last resort. No creature from Arkalla would take such a risk unless it was very serious. Suri goes on to explain that these distress calls are dangerous because they reach out to all those around them, even creatures from the great bounty. It’s likely that if she keeps it up, whoever is putting out the call will be tracked by the ominous and powerful Great Bounty. Suri urges the party to help her pursue this further.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group agrees and hastily exit the city’s walls on Suri’s directions.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Not far out of town, the group tries to keep pace as Suri leads them through a cluster of thick trees in an isolated area off the main road. Soon, the group stumbles upon the girl who must have put out the distress call.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A woman who shears Suri’s distinctive look and aura stands beside a human looking male. Both have weapons drawn, one holding a spear and the other a club. Nearby, a crazed woman nears them, her own scythe drawn. The crazed woman charges, and the man steps forward to protect the Suri-esque girl he’s with. He is injured by a vicious blow by the scythe and falls to the ground. As the crazed woman turns her attention towards the still standing foe, the man yells for his companion to run, calling her by the name of Isla.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTRESS CALL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group follows Rook as he sprints forward in an attempt to intervene and save the lives of both the injured man and the woman with the Suri-esque features named Isla.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A FAMILY BETRAYAL

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party makes their way back to the Hyde mansion to inform Elias on the events that have transpired.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias cannot believe that his close friend and confidant Hendrix Patel would be capable of such treason. He was one of the founders of Hyde afterall.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias reveals that ever since the founding of Hyde, Hendrix had always wanted Hyde to be under Brahmanian control. Apparently Hendrix always disagreed with Balthazar’s methods of rule. Their longtime disagreement over the proper ruler for the country likely caused Hendrix to cooperate with the Grim Deacons. Elias figures it must have been an attempt to seize control of Hyde for himself, though he still isn’t sure.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias also reveals that Hendrix is Teegan Patel’s husband. Nightingale remembers the woman who bought them rice balls and her heart sinks. She couldn’t imagine Teegan knowing anything about Hendrix’s treasonous plot. Regardless, Elias is convinced he’ll need to have her arrested and questioned.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles is dismayed to hear that his mother’s condition has worsened, Rivka was strong, but the Blight had no known cure. Despite the poor state of his mother, Elias still holds out for some sort of miracle to save her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: At the request of Nightingale, Elias pardons Justice’s alleged crimes in the Mines and allows Justice to go free and join Nightingale in investigating her own issues.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias offers the group a stay for the night at his estate. The group has their first night of good rest since Padric’s inn.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The next morning, Justice and Nightingale chat over breakfast about her magic book. Justice tells NIghtingale that it demands things from her as a trade off to use magic. She believes that it may be sentient.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice tells the rest of them that her friend Zafir, the man who may know more about the Maluma, can be located in the Carrion Swamps to the south.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles arrives to the kitchen and explains that his mother is stable, but not doing well. He says that his father has requested alone time and that a messenger will be sent if things change.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A FAMILY BETRAYAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group decides to stay the morning before leaving Hyde. Damocles joins them while they take some time to gear up in Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Celestial Gigas bores down on the party after a crushing defeat.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Isla pleads to the Lion-Beast to let them live, she argues they are only doing what they feel is right. Isla gives herself up as payment and as a show of her sincerity. The Lion-Beast accepts the offer, attributing their reckless decisions as a byproduct of the folly of man. However, the Lion-Beast explains that Isla will be judged here and now knowing full well that she is guilty for escaping her prison, and worse, involving and endangering humans.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Through tears, Isla agrees to the guilty plea. In a flash, the creature brutally tears Isla into pieces, satisfying the Great Bounty.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Showing some respect for Rook and the others for their commitment to doing what they believe is right, the giant creature pays them a reward for their decision in ultimately turning Isla over. The beast warns them that if this ever happens again, they will not be so lucky.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The time spent fighting the massive Lion-Beast proves to be too long for Faust. A long moment passes and the group comforts Faust as he dies in the grass nearby.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TUSSLE WITH MORTALS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: Judgement of Judas.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ARRIVING IN HYDE

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party finally enters the stone walls of Hyde. A smoggy, grey, mining town, covered in ash. Hyde isn’t the most welcoming sight. But it didn’t matter, they needed to find the person in charge so that they could ask about the whereabouts of a Theodotion Mage. Elias Hyde was both the Duke of Hyde and an old friend of Balthazar. He was known as kind and caring. Nightingale also knew how much Balthazar trusted him, so she thought that it was only fitting that she’d trust Elias too. More importantly, Elias Hyde would be the most likely person in the city to know more about the Theodotion mage.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They approach a nearby guard and ask for more information on where to find Elias Hyde. The guard points toward the sky to a lone manor sitting atop a massive hill.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The guard informs them that Elias, for some unknown reason, has been actively turning away visitors for some time now and doubts that this wandering group of kids will be any exception to that.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party ignores the warning and hikes up the steep pathways, making their way up towards the elusive Hyde manor. As they walk, they converse, trying to come up with a strategy on their official story. After their blunders in Rhamsted, they decide to create a cover story rather than go with the tried-and-true “royalty from Elenia” schtick.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Hyde’s are known as the most generous and hospitable of the Elenian royal families and Rook worries that something is wrong if Elias Hyde is turning away visitors.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ARRIVING IN HYDE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Regardless, after going through the plan and cover story, the group decides that it’s going to be too much work without resting first. They decide to unwind a bit and check out the mysterious ash covered city before attempting to convince another member of the royalty that they need help.

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACKHAND REVENGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: BLACKHAND REVENGE

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACKHAND REVENGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: It’s a rainy, unrelenting night. Over a steaming campfire, long after the others have gone to bed, Padric and Remi discuss what happened in Rhamsted. The two bond, and comfort each other knowing that both each tried their best. And despite Remi’s anger towards Aisling, seeing her father kill her in cold blood was still hurtful and unexpected. Regardless, Padric forgives her. He had feelings for Aisling, but he knew that what transpired wasn’t Remi’s fault. Instead, Padric blames Grace’s corruption and the Black Hand’s maliciousness.

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACKHAND REVENGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Together, the two mourn the brutal death of Aisling. Remi boils inside with anger and the two vow to exact revenge on Malik and Grace for what they’ve done.

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACKHAND REVENGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Meanwhile, Gage sleeps in Remi’s lap. And as she looks into the fantastic and cute cat’s sleeping face she can’t help but be reminded of her father’s more compassionate side.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COMING CLEAN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: COMING CLEAN

Sparknotes.TITLE: COMING CLEAN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As they follow Damocles out into the streets, Nightingale decides to tell Damocles the truth as to why they are in Hyde. She stops him to explain that they aren’t the original help his father sent for. Regardless, Nightingale still wants to help his family.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COMING CLEAN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles demands to know more so Nightingale elaborates. Nightingale catches Damocles up briefly, then explains that they are looking for a Theodotion mage.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COMING CLEAN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles figures that as long as they are willing to help him with his mother’s situation, he doesn’t care why they are here. More importantly, Damocles explains that he knows nothing of a Theodotion mage. However, if this fabled Theodotion magic was powerful enough to collapse a large section of the Hyde Mines, then it may be related to the explosion that occurred a few days ago.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COMING CLEAN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale begins to inquire to learn more, but Damocles cuts her short and explains that they’re going to see the jailer. He tells Nightingale that her questions would be better asked there.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COMING CLEAN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Apparently, Damocles already has a lead that none of them know about.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COUGHING GIRL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: COUGHING GIRL

Sparknotes.TITLE: COUGHING GIRL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party manages to rescue a girl in the mines. Her father thanks Damocles for being so brave and saving his daughter.

Sparknotes.TITLE: COUGHING GIRL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The girl doesn’t have time to say thank you and is instead ushered away for medical attention.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEFY THE GREAT BOUNTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: DEFY THE GREAT BOUNTY

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEFY THE GREAT BOUNTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Against their better judgement, the group refuses to hand over Isla to the Great Bounty.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEFY THE GREAT BOUNTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Lion-beast accepts this decision solemnly before ferociously attacking.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: EASY PEASY

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The team makes their way to the Harbinger Embassy in Hyde. They noticed how well-kept and pristine the building looks compared to the other crude stone buildings in the city of Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While walking through the vast vaulted hallway of the embassy, Nightingale dwells on the significance of the men and women who become Harbingers in their world.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While on Middara, people do not age, but they also cannot bear children. This is why Harbingers are required. They are the life-force of Middara. Children are born and raised on Earth and then brought to Middara via the Harbingers. This system does not come without a fight though. Powerful god-like creatures ironically deemed “angels” protect Earth children from capture.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale snaps out of her deep thought as she approaches the front desk. Behind the counter is one of the oldest men on Middara she’d ever seen. He introduces himself as Lyle and asks what he can help with, and to be quick about it. The embassy is closing.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale reluctantly informs Lyle of her identity and demands that the Patel case be opened up again.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Lyle doesn’t believe that Nightingale is the second Princess of Elenia, and even if he did, Lyle tells her that there is nothing he can do. The foster mother died, she was the one who knew about the existence of Middara and the father isn’t going to just give his daughter away to strangers. At this point, the Harbingers are at a stand-still short of breaking into the house and kidnapping the girl. And as any “Princess of Elenia” would know, this is avoided at all cost. They’ve decided to sit on it to see if the situation changes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale tells Lyle that due to her status, she has private Harbingers in the city of Elenia that she could recruit for the job and make it happen. Lyle only laughs and asks why she doesn’t just ask them before denying her demand once again.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook asks the Lyle if there is anything else they may be able to do for him to convince him otherwise. They are adventurers afterall.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Lyle’s demeanor immediately changes as he welcomes a bribe. Lyle tell the team that if they were to fetch him the rare “Corpse Lotus” from the nearby Corpse Pond, then he may be able to pull some strings.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group asks why he wants a Corpse Lotus but Lyle only claims it’s worth a lot of money.

Sparknotes.TITLE: EASY PEASY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Flag Check: Does the party have Experienced Guide?

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ENDING THE PAIN

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale whispers into Damocles’ ear. She kindly points out the struggle Elias is going through.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles takes Nightingale’s advice. He steps up as the one who must kill his mother. He cannot allow his father to be the one to do it. Elias protests but Damocles doesn’t have to fight long before Elias backs down.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles pulls out his dagger, an heirloom given to him by the very woman he’s about to kill. Despite Rivka’s deteriorating grotesque features, Damocles still only feels love her her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles holds the blade to his mother’s chest, then, he tells Rivka he loves her one last time before he plunges the knife into her heart.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rivka is finally at rest.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING THE PAIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: A Son’s Love

Sparknotes.TITLE: FAUST’S FATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FAUST’S FATE

Sparknotes.TITLE: FAUST’S FATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Faust lie in a hospital bed in Hyde, making a slow recovery, but clearly heartbroken by the fate of his beloved friend Isla.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FAUST’S FATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale apologizes for not being able to save Isla. Faust doesn’t blame them. The creature was too powerful to disobey.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FAUST’S FATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Faust makes Rook promise him to be careful around Suri. He makes it clear that Suri is taking a great risk by being on Middara at all. Then, Faust asks to be left alone and the party leaves him to his solitude.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FAUST’S FATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: A Lonely Survivor.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FIGHTING TO HER LAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FIGHTING TO HER LAST

Sparknotes.TITLE: FIGHTING TO HER LAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias whispers one last goodbye to his wife before drawing his sword. He takes a deep breath, but it’s clear that he’s shaky and will have a very hard time committing the deed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FIGHTING TO HER LAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a long moment of hesitation, Elias finally swings for Rivka’s neck. Rivka jolts to the side at the last moment in a sudden moment of rage. Elias cuts one of her restraints instead.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FIGHTING TO HER LAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rivka savagely lunges for Elias. She begs for him to kill her so that she won’t hurt him. Elias goes to the ground but is seemingly able to cut her throat before he’s infected himself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FIGHTING TO HER LAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The ordeal is clearly a horrific experience for Elias and he’s left shaken and emotionally distraught.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FIGHTING TO HER LAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: A Husband’s Duty

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING ANOTHER WAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FINDING ANOTHER WAY

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING ANOTHER WAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke is a terrible liar and the group fails to convince the guards to let them into the Hyde estate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING ANOTHER WAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Away and out of earshot of the guards, Remi reminds everyone about her original suggestion of finding some other way into the estate. The group decides that it’s worth the risk. They had to talk to Elias, Nightingale’s life was at stake.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING ANOTHER WAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After searching around the property for long while, the group discovers a hidden tunnel just outside of the property. It seemed mighty convenient, but that intrigued the group even more.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING ANOTHER WAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Together the group crawls down through a winding rock passage until it opens up underground.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING ANOTHER WAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: There is a sudden scraping sound down in the dark. The group draws their weapons slowly proceed with caution.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FOREVER MARKED

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Although bloodied and defeated, the massive Lion-Beast threatens the party, telling them that their choices were foolish. They are now forever marked by the Great Bounty. The time will come where they will be called to pay for their crimes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The monster departs quickly, tearing open a pocket of space before disappearing inside of it with a snap of energy.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With Faust slowly dying, the group turns to rush him to Hyde for medical attention.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Reward: In his hasty retreat, the Celestial Gigas drops a strange artifact.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: Marked.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOREVER MARKED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Special: Depending on how much time has passed, continue to a different scene.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FREED FROM THIS REALM

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a long, treacherous battle, the party stand exhausted, thinking of ways to proceed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Isla is frantic next to the body of her human friend. She calls him Faust. And as Faust lie bleeding to death on the ground, blood soaking his tunic from a horrific wound, Rook worries for his survival.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook does his best to help but still doesn’t have much hope for Faust’s survival.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook asks how Isla got to Middara in the first place. Suri explains that creatures from different dimensions can create a Soul Bond with each other, allowing them to take physical form and stay in another realm permanently. Suri explains that Faust is Isla’s Soul Bond and to Bond with one from Arkalla is highly illegal. Although a Soul Bond is usually permitted, Suri’s homeworld of Arkalla is one of the dimensions that is off limits from travel. Suri angrily explains that Isla was stupid and endangered Faust by Soul Bonding with him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Isla ignores Suri and pleads to the group to save Faust.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri begins to usher them to grab Faust so that they might leave. Suri explains that they must hurry before the Great Bounty arrives but she’s cut short as the sun blots out and darkness looms over them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Dread overcomes Suri as a dark opening tears into the sky above them. An agent of the Great Bounty was already here. Suri whisps away, giving Rook one last desperate look before vanishing in fear at the newcomer.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Descending from the skies, a massive lion-like creature, three stories tall with flowing feathery wings like something out of the book of Revelations lands nearby.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The beast introduces itself as an agent of the Great Bounty. Promising that it means humans no harm. Instead, the creature congratulates them for bringing it two lawbreakers. It cordially asks the party to hand over Isla as it turns on the Living Oblation. The red headed girl with the scythe struggles with her injuries and crawls in a vain attempt to escape.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The giant beast leans down over the squirming Living Oblation. The red headed girl screams out as the Lion-Beast tears the human vessel into pieces, exposing the creature that was habitating the human body. It explodes out of the carcass like a black ooze, similar to the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Then, the massive lion creature turns to Nightingale, Rook, Remi, and Zeke, and politely asks again that they hand over Isla for their payment.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Faust still lay dying and Isla tells them to do whatever they need to do, but Faust is her only concern. Save him and she’ll be happy. Isla turns to the group for a decision.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale voices no opinion, she just doesn’t want to be in the presence of the Lion-Beast any longer. She covers her mouth in horror at the idea of the monster tearing her apart to get at the Maluma within herself. Somewhere deep within her, she feels the Maluma shrink and disappear as though it too was fearful of the monster.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook hates that the Great Bounty police’s their realm for any reason. He feels that those who want to be together should be allowed. Somewhere deep down Rook would like to have Suri with him at all times. But he also knows that Faust will die without prompt medical care. Protesting this Lion-Beast’s wishes could prove to take too much time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke lost the cigarette out of his mouth not long after he watched the Living Oblation get torn apart. He didn’t feel the need to be next, so he opts to hand over Isla and get Faust immediate medical attention.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Meanwhile, Remi can’t bear seeing someone else eviscerated again. She worries Isla will be killed if they hand her over so she protests the decision.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FREED FROM THIS REALM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Decision: Protect Isla or hand her over to the Great Bounty.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRATEFUL FAMILIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: GRATEFUL FAMILIES

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRATEFUL FAMILIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: On the way out of town, the party is stopped by a group of Hyde citizens.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRATEFUL FAMILIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The families of the rescued miners can’t let them leave without a proper thanks. They show their gratitude to Damocles and thank him and his friends for saving lives and insists on them taking a reward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRATEFUL FAMILIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles feels proud and Justice feels a bit exonerated as the party turns to leave Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRATEFUL FAMILIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Reward: The thankful families hook Damocles up with a reward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRATEFUL FAMILIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Flag Check: Depending on your flags, continue to the appropriate scene.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HAND OVER ISLA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: HAND OVER ISLA

Sparknotes.TITLE: HAND OVER ISLA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With hesitation, the group decides to hand over Isla, denying the monstrous creature and agent of the Great bounty could prove to be a terrible idea in the long run.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HAND OVER ISLA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Isla accepts her fate and resigns herself to the Great Bounty, trembling as she approaches the massive beast.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HAND OVER ISLA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The agent of The Great Bounty acknowledges the wise decision and tears open a portal into another world. He then tosses the group a bag of gold for their capture of a criminal.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HAND OVER ISLA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The agent of The Great Bounty watches as Isla enter the portal. Moments before she enters, Isla turns to the group and tells them to save Faust before disappearing through the portal. The Lion-beast follows her through and with a loud crack, the portal vanishes as quickly as it appeared.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HAND OVER ISLA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Reward: The Lion-Beast pays you for your services.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOW MUCH HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: HOW MUCH HELP

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOW MUCH HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group is forced to retreat and eventually loses their pursuers in the labyrinthine mines. After a long walk, they eventually make their way to the wide cavern that Justice had been leading them toward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOW MUCH HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook can’t believe how many monsters are down in the mines. He hopes that the guards will be able to handle the infestation better than they have.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOW MUCH HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice apologizes for the infestation of creatures and explains that while the presence of many are directly her fault for opening up the walls, the Blighted Guardians shouldn’t have been down here regardless. The human’s she ran into were likely behind the presence of the Blighted Guardians.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOW MUCH HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles thanks them for the help anyway. He only hopes that all this work can save his mother.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’M SORRY, SURI
Sparknotes.CONTENT: I’M SORRY, SURI

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’M SORRY, SURI
Sparknotes.CONTENT: In failure, Rook apologizes to Suri. The girl fighting for her life, the one the man called Isla must have been from Arkalla too. But Isla was dead now, and it was because they failed to save her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’M SORRY, SURI
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri is disappointed, but thanks them for their attempt to help one of her sisters from Arkalla.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’M SORRY, SURI
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook asks how Isla got to Middara in the first place. Suri explains that creatures from different dimensions can create a Soul Bond with each other, allowing them to take physical form and stay in another realm permanently. Although a Soul Bond is usually permitted, Suri’s homeworld of Arkalla is one of the dimensions that is off limits from travel. Suri angrily explains that Isla was stupid and endangered the man she Soul Bonded with. Suri doesn’t blame Rook for their failure to save Isla, she blames Isla for her recklessness that got herself and someone she loved killed. Suri ushers them away, telling them that they must leave before the Great Bounty arrives. The Great bounty has a track record for punishing anyone involved with such mingling.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’M SORRY, SURI
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke lights up cigarette and wipes at his brow before agreeing with Suri and claiming that they still have a Theodotion Mage that needs to be found.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO HIDING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: INTO HIDING

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO HIDING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After anxiously waiting in the hospital lobby, the doctor emerges. Due to the party dealing with the Celestial Gigas so quickly,  Faust pulls through and survives his wounds.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO HIDING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Isla is beyond relieved that her beloved Faust will recover.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO HIDING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri reiterates the seriousness of the matter at hand. The Great Bounty will not forget this decision. Suri leaves them all with a word of warning.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO HIDING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Isla ignores Suri’s warning and thanks the group for their help before bidding them farewell.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO HIDING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: Happy Fugitives.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Hyde jail was mostly barren other than one occupied cell. The jailer briefs Damocles on the explosion and the events that transpired from it. Apparently someone destroyed a large section of the Hyde Mines and the results were devastating. Luckily they caught someone they think was responsible.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Jailer points to a cell and the group confronts the occupant.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The occupant of the cell is a girl that looks anything but threatening. She’s small in stature, with big blue eyes and even bigger circular rimmed spectacles.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The jailer explains to Damocles that this girl was found amongst the debris of the explosion without so much as a scratch on her. The whole thing was very puzzling. On top of that, she had a large book with her that confusingly could not be separated from her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The worst part is that the explosion was so large that it blew holes into parts of the mines shaft that had been closed off due to monster infestations. These monsters were now free to roam the mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles approaches the cell and demands an answer to what happened. The girl only cowers at his rage, scooting farther into the back of her cell.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale intervenes and takes a different approach to the interrogation. She had a hunch that this jailed girl was the Theodotion mage they’d been looking for. Assuming such, Nightingale tells the girl that she is infected with a horrible parasite called the Maluma and she believes that Theodotion is the only way to save her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: At the mention of Theodotion, the girl becomes receptive.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The occupant of the cell wearlily introduces herself to Nightingale as Justice Bouchard. She asks Nightingale how she knows that she can use Theodotion. Nightingale tells Justice the truth. She explains that she didn’t, but that she desperately needs her help.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice stammers, explaining with a sorrowful voice that it was all an accident. Justice tells them that she was in the mines with her friends and they were looking for something when they were attacked by Blighted Guardians being controlled by humans. The explosion was in self defense. She apologized profusely.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook asks if the explosion has something to do with how dangerous Theodotion is, Justice nods. She confirms that controlling such a magic is difficult, and the power that was unleashed was a mistake that was goated out of self preservations. The humans after them weren’t going to let her live otherwise.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles interjects and demands to know who and where her friends are.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice’ face twists in agony. She tears up as she explains that they died in the ambush. They weren’t the only ones looking in the Mines. Now they’re all dead. The humans controlling the Blighted Guardians killed them. When she was finally cornered, she used her magic to save her own life. She killed the people who attacked them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice seems genuinely hurt over what had transpired. Damocles shows her no remorse. Instead, he only scoffs and questions her more. The fact that Blighted Guardians were involved meant that this was connected to the attack on his estate and the infection of his mother. Damocles asks Justice if she knows anything more about the Blighted Guardians and explains what happened at his estate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice confirms that she thinks she knows where the cages were kept that held them. She claims that there is a sort of operation deep within the mines where the Blighted creatures are being studied. Justice also claims that if they free her, she might be able to help with Maluma issue afterwards. She can’t cure Nightingale, but she knows who might be able too.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice quickly makes a deal with Nightingale and Damocles. If they let her go free, she will lead the party down to where she saw the Blighted Guardians in cages and guide Nightingale to the acquaintance she claims can help remove the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles reluctantly agrees only after Nightingale presses him on the issue.

Sparknotes.TITLE: JUSTICE IN THE DUNGEONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Party Member: Justice Bouchard.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LISTEN HERE!

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Unable to overcome the infestation of monsters in the hidden tunnel, the party retreats and makes their way back to the Hyde manor’s gate. Realizing that the threat beneath the estate supersedes their need for secrecy, Nightingale confronts the guards.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The guards glare at them dubiously as they approach.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale comes clean about their identity and tells the guards of the serious monster infestation in the hidden tunnel below the Hyde Estate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Hyde family has apparently already officially called for help from Elenia due to some disease that is spreading. For these reasons, the guards assume that Nightingale and the others must be the help from Elenia that they sent for.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The guards let them pass and lead the group to the main room of the Hyde manor where a man waits for them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias Hyde welcomes them, and has them take a seat before introducing himself. Elias looks worn and his face droops in misery. Behind the expensive clothing and jewelry, it’s clear that something is wrong. Before Nightingale can inquire, another man appears, and  Elias introduces the man as his son, Damocles.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LISTEN HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles is intimidating, apprehensive, and tall. He sits nearby and suspiciously stares at the party.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LITTLE GOLD LIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LITTLE GOLD LIE

Sparknotes.TITLE: LITTLE GOLD LIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke and Nightingale track down Teegan Patel to tell her their fabricated story.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LITTLE GOLD LIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke exclaims that the Corpse collector bested them and they were unable to snag the Lotus.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LITTLE GOLD LIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale chimes in and explains that Lyle didn’t trust them anyway. Nightingale then promises that she will see what she can do about the situation once she gets back to Elenia. It’s an empty promise though, and Nightingale can’t help but feel guilty.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LITTLE GOLD LIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Teegan understands the situation and doesn’t hold it against them. Instead, Teegan appreciates them trying at all. Before departing, Teegan hypes herself up, confident that she’ll find another way to get her daughter to Middara. Then, she lets them know that she hopes to meet again one day.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LOTUS FOR A CHILD

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Back at the Harbinger embassy, the team approaches Lyle with the Corpse Lotus. Ecstatic, Lyle tells his secretary to fetch a basin of water to place the flower in.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke demands that he holds up his end of the bargain before receiving the Lotus.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Lyle pulls out a file from his desk, scribbles some notes and promises to send the letter out to Regional with the next caravan.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke threatens that there will be repercussions from the Jeong family if Lyle’s promises are not met. Lyle only chuckles and waves them away.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party makes their way back to Teegan’s estate. It isn’t hard to find seeing as all they had to do was look for the second largest mansion in the town. Apparently the Patel family had some importance in the town.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Teegan is endlessly thankful for their work and promises to meet again one day.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Special: Discard the Corpse Lotus Item.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOTUS FOR A CHILD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: The Patel Daughter.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINER RESCUE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MINER RESCUE

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINER RESCUE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A frantic man runs up to Damocles while the party is exploring the city. More beasts have escaped through the blown out crater and some miners are trapped.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINER RESCUE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles rushes to their aid and the group follows intending to help save the miners.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINERS EXTRACTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MINERS EXTRACTED

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINERS EXTRACTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A crowd of residents of Hyde cheer as the party surfaces from the mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINERS EXTRACTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: At least some of the miners were successfully rescued.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINERS EXTRACTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles is congratulated for such a brave selfless act.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINERS EXTRACTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: Avoiding Collapse.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MINERS EXTRACTED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Flag Check: New Ambitions.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice finally leads everyone to the space where the Theodotion explosion originally occurred. It was a gory sight and it gives Nightingale flashbacks of the informant’s house and his unfortunate demise.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The traces of the original mine were barely visible. The crater from the explosion that took place was huge and left a chasm that stretched across the underground in a way that was unreal.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While the others take in the horrific sight, Justice begins searching for something immediately upon arrival.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As Justice pokes at dark corners in her search, Nightingale pulls herself away from the traces of human still littering the crater to ask Justice more about what happened. Nightingale asks about the people that were after her in the mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice tells Nightingale that it was Grim Deacons.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook’s interest is piqued by the mention of Grim Deacons. He turns and asks Justice to confirm that by the Grim Deacons, she means the same Grim Deacons that are well known as very talented Brahmanian Spies and soldiers.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice nods, confirming that Rook is spot on in his analysis.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles overhears and worries at the news. He’s heard of the Grim Deacons. They’re notorious elite killers for the aristocracies of Brahma, the country to the west. They’re hard to kill, and incredibly connected.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice turns to explain that the Grim Deacons are after the friend she wants to take Nightingale too. His name is Zafir and he’s likely to be able to help them out with the Maluma issue.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The mention of Grim Deacons causes Rook to become increasingly more wary.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice reassured them that the Grim Deacons were caught in the blast and makeup half of the bodies here. So there is no need to worry. She seems confident that the blast killed all three of them although there was a fourth individual who did not look like a Grim Deacon but instead looked like a resident of Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles goes to ask more about the fourth man but Justice mentions he ran off into a nearby tunnel that has collapsed. She’s certain it’s where they needed to go.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Finally, and with a triumphant gasp, Justice finds what she and her friends were after. She holds up an irregular white rock in the corner of the room and laughs triumphantly.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles swipes the rock from Justice and curiously asks what it is.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice calls it a pontifex. Or… at least part of one. It’s something Zafir was after. She explains that she doesn’t know what it does exactly, they were on orders from Zafir to get it for him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Something stirs inside Nightingale, the Maluma thunders inside her mind. It yearns for the Pontifex piece and part of its feelings impart upon Nightingale and she too feels the need for this artifact.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale, in a trance-like state of submission to the Maluma, snatches the Pontifex piece from Damocles. Nightingale claims that she’s the Princess of Elenia and this belongs to her before anyone else present in the mines. Nightingale says that she’ll keep watch of the Pontifex piece until Justice’s end of the bargain is fulfilled. Then, she’ll give it to Zafir only if she deems that it’s safe.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Item: First Piece of the Pontifex.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Both Damocles and Justice seem bummed about Nightingale’s decision for different reasons but they both submit to it being fair. Nightingale is the Princess of Elenia after all.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles asks if everyone is ready to continue towards where the fourth man ran off too. They agree, and Justice leads them to the collapsed section she mentioned earlier. After a short moment the group is able to squeeze themselves into a tight corridor. The party continues down the corridor a very long way until they finally reach a thick locked stone door.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles suggests that Justice cause another explosion to blow through the door but Justice refuses, saying that anytime she uses her Theodotion magic, a price must be paid to her Tome. Confused, Damocles simply accepts the answer without further explanation.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Just then, Remi leans in, hearing voices on the other side of the door.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group hear two different people talking, a man and a woman. The woman is furious with the man for failing to kill “the Duke and his heir”.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The man assures the woman by the name of Echo that Elias’ infected wife will soon “turn”. Nobody survives the Blight, and Rivka will be no different. Elias will not have the willpower to execute his own wife and will thus become infected himself. The plan is all coming together.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Frustrated. Echo responds to the man by the name of Hendrix. She’s furious with Hendrix’s lack of initiative. Echo suggests they infect Hyde’s water system with The Blight. She explains that if they can uproot the city, Brahmanian plans can move forward with occupation.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: From listening to the two voices talk, It seemed a Grim Deacon by the name of Echo is conspiring with someone by the name of Hendrix.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles knew Hendrix. And hearing the man plot the demise of Hyde and his family drove Damocles’ face white with anger. Enough was enough, Damocles angrily orders Justice to use her magic to blast their way through.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Confronted with his anger, Justice reconsiders using her magic. She channels energy from her giant book and focuses it on the stone door. The door rots away as if time itself was destroying it. After the door shrivels, there’s an explosion of dust as the passage before them explodes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Through the dust and madness, the party makes out what’s behind the door. It looks like a primitive laboratory of some sort with cages and vials and syringes and experiments of all sorts. The explosion caused by Justice sent the equipment scattering and the room was now a mess.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Echo and Hendrix were now clearly visible. Damocles had always seen Hendrix as one of his fathers best friends. He had always trusted Hendrix to protect Hyde. Instead, Damocles finds him conspiring with a Grim Deacon and the culprit behind his mother’s impending demise.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: This betrayal sends Damocles into a blind rage. He charges into the room as the debris and dust still settles. He makes a lunge to tackle Hendrix.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Fed up with Hendrix’s incompetency, Echo grabs a sketchy looking syringe off of a table and injects Hendrix with its contents.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Hendrix immediately starts pustulating and turning pale. He screams at the realization he’s been infected with such a pure form of the Blight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before anyone can stop Echo, she disappears into the far exit and escapes through a door.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MURMURS BEHIND THE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Meanwhile, Damocles tries to get information from Hendrix, but it’s too late. The man’s form twists into something inhuman and he screams in pain as he’s turned into something horrible.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MY DUTY

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles wants the Grim Deacon called Echo to pay for her involvement in his mother’s death. Angry and out for revenge, Damocles arrives with packs ladened with gear as the party is turning to leave Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice explains that the Swamps of Gehenna are incredibly dangerous. She cautions Damocles on his choice to join the party but he isn’t deterred.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles explains that he isn’t going to rest until he avenges his mother and finds and  uncovers every detail. Damocles vows to punish everyone who was involved in the plot of Rivka’s murder and the threat to Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Together, the group begins to head out of the city.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Party Member: Damocles joins the party.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY DUTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Flag Check: Depending on your flags, continue to the appropriate scene.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT RICH ENOUGH TO WIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NOT RICH ENOUGH TO WIN

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT RICH ENOUGH TO WIN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi and Rook win the Bellicose fight. Jovial trash-talking ensues.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The team journeys further into the wooded mountains and approached the Corpse Pond.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: All along the way Padric urged them to turn back. He feels like this is a terrible idea and explains that Corpse Collectors get their names for a reason… They collect corpses.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: That becomes all too apparent as they reach a clearing where the pond is located. Sure enough, there are bodies floating all around. Most are clearly animal parts, but others look more human in origin.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: In the center of the pond floated an exquisite golden flower surrounded by a mysterious glowing mist.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S EXPERIENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Having seen ponds like this before, Padric says that they may be in luck if they stay on this side of the lake. Hopefully, The Corpse Collector may already be dead.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While walking around Hyde, a woman recognizes Nightingale and frantically runs up to her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke jokes that their plans of falsifying their identities has already failed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The woman introduces herself as Teegan Patel. She invites the party to dinner and explains that the Patel family is close friends with the Hyde’s. She even seems know both Nightingale’s and Zeke’s parent’s personally.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Hoping that Teegan Patel can be convinced not to blow their cover, Rook and the others agree to go out to dinner with her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Teegan leads them to a hole-in-the-wall rice ball joint and they sit down for what Teegan claims are the best rice balls in all of Elenia. During dinner, the group learns that Teegan and her husband were with Elias Hyde and both Zeke and Nightingale’s parents when Elenia was founded. Impressed, Rook wants to know more about her past but is cut short when Teegan reveals that she needs Nightingale’s help.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Teegan explains that she has a daughter on Earth. Apparently, her daughter’s foster mother died and the father refused to give her up to the Harbingers when they came from Middara to get her. Teegan pleads with Nightingale to use her status as a princess to petition the Hyde Harbinger contingent to try and collect her daughter a second time, this time, making sure that her daughter is forced to come to Middara.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group has mixed opinions on forcing someone from Earth to give up their child against their will, but ultimately they agree to help in hopes that Teegan will return the favor.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PATEL FAMILY INFLUENCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Reward: It looks like you have some leftovers!

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST TO BE THE BEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: QUEST TO BE THE BEST

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST TO BE THE BEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The team goes to a tavern called “The Brass Lantern” to play some Abraxis Battle Dice. Hopefully they get some sweet loot!

Sparknotes.TITLE: RECKLESS ADVENTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: RECKLESS ADVENTURE

Sparknotes.TITLE: RECKLESS ADVENTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The clearing where the pond was located was one of the greenest and most serene places the team had ever seen.

Sparknotes.TITLE: RECKLESS ADVENTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Just in the distance was the infamous Corpse Pond, staying true to the name. Bloated corpses of both animals and what looked like people were shriveled and floating just above the surface of the water.

Sparknotes.TITLE: RECKLESS ADVENTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: In the center of the pond floated an exquisite golden flower. It seemed easy enough to swim in and grab, although the murky water surrounding it was daunting to say the least.

Sparknotes.TITLE: RECKLESS ADVENTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Wanting to get it over with, Zeke jumps in to snag the Lotus. He quickly noticed how numbingly cold the water is.

Sparknotes.TITLE: RECKLESS ADVENTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before he can get any closer, Zeke realizes he is surrounded by a pack of amphibious dog-like creatures and swears as he fumbles for his weapon.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REST IN PEACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: REST IN PEACE

Sparknotes.TITLE: REST IN PEACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric shows the group his favorite place to swim on the coast of Elenia. The group settles down and are able to relax a bit on the beach.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REST IN PEACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric makes sure to do what he can to let the group blow off steam. He makes a fire pit to cook food and cracks open some drinks he brought along from his own establishment. Everyone drinks Padric’s beers and eats his famous kabobs.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REST IN PEACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The warm sun feels good, and the group is able to forget about some of the horrors they witnessed, if only for a moment.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REST IN PEACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: During the celebration, Padric pours a beer out for Aisling, and silently pays his respect to his dead friend.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SEAL THAT THING UP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SEAL THAT THING UP

Sparknotes.TITLE: SEAL THAT THING UP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group retreats in the direction Echo had ran off to as Hendrix begins to overwhelm them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SEAL THAT THING UP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Once through the door, Justice screams and uses her magic again to collapse the tunnel behind them to prevent Hendrix from making a pursuit.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SEAL THAT THING UP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Exhausted from using her magic, Justice allows herself to be supported as the group follows after the direction that Echo went. Through the door they find a long corridor. Not long later they find themselves overlooking the city of Hyde from a hidden entrance in the hill side.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SEAL THAT THING UP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles thanks the group for their help. Even though they were unable to kill Hendrix, they were able to gather all the information they need to inform Elias of Hendrix’s collusion with the Grim Deacons.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SECRET ENTRANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SECRET ENTRANCE

Sparknotes.TITLE: SECRET ENTRANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Beyond the monsters and other horrific creatures beneath the Hyde Estate, the party travels deeper into the tunnels until they come upon a solid piece of metal seated against the stone wall at the end of a tight tunnel. The group squeezes forward and push against the metal until it opens spilling the group into a dark room. Looking around, they realize that they are inside of a cellar.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SECRET ENTRANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Believing that this has to be the Hyde Estate, Rook begins to worry that this tunnel was either an old escape tunnel for the royalty, or it was dug for a more nefarious purpose. The group isn’t able to theorize as a crash and a yell nearby signals to the group that they’ve been discovered by someone inside of the cellar.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SECRET ENTRANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Inside the cellar is a tall angry looking man with red eyes and a flowing purple cloak. Seeing the group come out of a hidden tunnel inside of the Cellar, the man accuses them as intruders in his house and criminals who are behind a recent attack on his Estate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SECRET ENTRANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group tries to explain why they’re inside of his but the man cuts them off with a shout. He accuses them of infecting his mother with some sort of disease before angrily reaching out with magic and summoning a pair of Espers to aid him. The three them move to engage in a fight with who they are convinced are violent intruders.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SERIOUS SITUATION

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias leads the party into his estate to discuss the matters at hand. As they walk, Elias explains that he’s be waiting a long time for the requested help from Elenia to arrive. He didn’t know that the princess of Elenia herself would be the one they’d send to help him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale only smiles, keeping up the lie and hoping Elias explains more without her having to ask any questions. Luckily, he does.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias then explains his perils and informs the party of a sort of disease that is spreading within the city  of Hyde called The Blight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: People infected with The Blight devolve into mindless, bloodthirsty monsters called Blighted Guardians. Recently, everything came to a dramatic head when a Blighted Guardian found its way into the Hyde Estate during the night and attack Elias’ wife Rivka.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias explains solemnly that Rivka is not doing well. As he begins to point out the severity and declining health of his wife Elias is unable to finish the sentence as despair overtakes him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: His son, Damocles, steps forward and tells the party about a Blighted Guardian that had broken into their house and attacked his mother Rivka and infected her with The Blight. They didn’t know how it got in previously, but with the discovery of the tunnels they found, it was clear that it came from beyond the entrance and in the cellar where the party fell from.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: This confirms that the entrance found was unknown to the Hyde family. Rook is relieved, their discovery was more important than he could have imagined.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook expresses his knowledge about The Blight to his friends. It’s well known that there is no cure and anyone infected by the horrific disease meets a terrible end. Rook knows that Rivka likely doesn’t have long before she is turned into a Blighted Guardian herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias confirms Rook’s concern and let’s them all know that this investigation must be done with discretion in mind.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Both Damocles and Elias suspect foul play behind the recent surge of Blighted victims in Hyde. Especially now that they discovered those hidden tunnels, it’s likely that whoever was behind their construction is directly behind the recent outbreak and Rivka’s infection.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles adds that there was an incident in the mines a few days prior. Not long after the attack on their estate and Rivka’s infection, there was an explosion in the mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
