Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles suspects that this explosion has something to do with whoever is behind all this madness.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias asks Nightingale and the others to help them find and apprehend the individuals responsible for building the tunnels and the explosion in the mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before they can leave, Elias pauses to look at Nightingale softly. Elias reminds her that he’s the King’s appointed duke in Hyde. He served Balthazar faithfully and helped explore these wildlands before this town even existed. He’s happy to see the Princess herself stepping up to help the Hyde family in their time of need. Her friends were even recommended by Shayliss Arsen herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias then promises to keep her safe. He appoints Damocles to accompany them and to get ot the bottom of the events that are transpiring.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Not wanting to give her cover away, Nightingale only smiles and thanks Elias. However, she wonders who Shayliss had originally intended to send as the help.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles promises to not let his father down and then briskly moves passed the group. Waving a hand for them to follow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SERIOUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: Elias’s Gratitude.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHOWING THEM THE ROPES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SHOWING THEM THE ROPES

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHOWING THEM THE ROPES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While exploring Hyde, the party comes across the Hyde Bellicose Arena. The Bellicose Arena is a popular sport on Middara that pitches teams against each other in battle. Luckily, a magical item called a Bellicose Cube keeps participants from serious harm while also allowing them to not hold back.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHOWING THEM THE ROPES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After bantering about their favorite Bellicose teams and some famous matches in Middaran history, the group is urged by Padric to play a match. The group excitedly decide to blow off some steam by engaging in some good old fashioned combat with each other.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHOWING THEM THE ROPES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric pairs the Zeke and Nightingale up and then pitches the royalty against their friends.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SLAIN HENDRIX

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The corpse of Hendrix Patel sits in a collapsed heap on the ground. Damocles expresses how important the Patel family had been to the prosperity of Hyde. He still couldn’t believe that they’d betray them like this. To conspire with Grim Deacons was treason.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice stammers in confusion. She swears that the Grim Deacon Hendrix was with, the one he called Echo, was killed in the initial blast that brought them to the mines in the first place. Justice even claims that she saw her crumpled destroyed body torn to bits. There was no way she could have survived her magical blast that tore down the mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale finds herself continually looking towards Justice’s spell book. Somewhere inside that incredible source of power might be the cure she needed. Nightingale presses the party to take a look around so that they can get out of these mines.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party begins feverish searching the laboratory for clues as to how to Blight can be cured. Unfortunately, all the books in the lab seemed to be instruction manuals on how to spread disease, not cure it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After digging through the books for hours, they decide to pile them up on the body of Hendrix and burn the remains.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group follows after the direction that Echo went. Through the door they find a long corridor. Not long later they find themselves overlooking the city of Hyde from a hidden entrance in the hill side.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles thanks the group for their help and together they decide to inform Elias of Hendrix’s collusion with the Grim Deacons.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SLAIN HENDRIX
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: An End to Madness.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SMOOTH TALKER

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The deception works and Zeke and the others feign their confidence with the guards. Unknown to them, it seems that the guards were apparently already awaiting  a group of adventurers. Under the impression that they are the hired help sent for from the capital of the City of Elenia, the guards let them into the Hyde Estate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The team is ushered into Elias’ quarters to discuss the supposed issue at hand. The group keeps their calm, hoping that they aren’t supposed to know too much about the issue at hand.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After entering, the team keeps up the facade, telling all the guards and Elias Hyde himself that they are seasoned adventurers sent from Elenia to help with Elias’ still unknown situation.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias welcomes them, and has them take a seat before introducing himself. Elias looks worn and his face droops in misery. Behind the expensive clothing and jewelry, it’s clear that something is wrong. Before Nightingale can inquire, another man appears, and  Elias introduces the man as his son, Damocles.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles is intimidating, apprehensive, and tall. He sits nearby and stares at the party as the four continue to expand upon their lie of being the hired help that the Hyde family sent for.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias exclaims that he’s be waiting a long time for help from Elenia to arrive. Elias then explains his perils and informs the party of a sort of disease that is spreading within the city called The Blight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: People infected with The Blight devolve into mindless, bloodthirsty monsters called Blighted Guardians. Recently, everything came to a dramatic head when a Blighted Guardian found its way into the Hyde Estate during the night and attack Elias’ wife Rivka.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias explains solemnly that Rivka is not doing well. He goes on to explain that he fears that she’s been infected with The Blight herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook expresses his knowledge about The Blight to his friends. It’s known that there is no cure and anyone infected by the horrific disease meets a terrible end. Rook knows that Rivka likely doesn’t have long before she is turned into a Blighted Guardian herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias confirms Rook’s concern and let’s them all know that this investigation must be done with discretion in mind. With that, Elias hands a small bag of coins to them as payment for their work.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias suspects foul play behind the recent surge of Blighted victims in Hyde. He explains that in the same timeframe that his wife was attacked, there was an explosion in the mines of Hyde. Whatever was going on in Hyde, he requested outside help to help take care of it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias requires the party’s assistance in investigating the cause of The Blight

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale begins asking about Rivka’s condition but she is cut short by Elias. Elias tells Nightingale that his wife is none of their concern. Instead, he only requires that they worry about the mine and catch those who are responsible for this attack on a royal family. Elias sternly reminds them that he’s the King’s appointed duke. He served Balthazar faithfully and helped explore these wildlands before this town even existed. He feels that he is owed some assistance, and they were recommended by the first Princess, Shayliss Arsen herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale agrees, not wanting to give her cover away. Together, the group rises to leave but is stopped before they make it out the door.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Elias adds that his son will be accompanying them into the mines. Damocles will be able to grant them any clearance they might need.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles rises quickly and briskly moves passed the group. Waving a hand, Damocles commands them to follow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SMOOTH TALKER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Reward: Elias pays the party for their discretion.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: STOP!

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Bruised and beaten, the party lies defeated in the cellar while their attacker prepares to finish everyone off.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suddenly, another man bursts in and yells to their Attacker, calling him by the name Damocles. He stops him from inflicting any harm on Nightingale. Damocles is flustered and confused, he turns and asks his father why he should stop from punishing those breaking into their house.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: His father introduces himself as Elias Hyde and apologizes, helping Nightingale to her feet. He chastises Damocles for attacking without thinking. Unlike him, Elias had recognized the second Princess of Elenia, Nightingale Arsen. Elias explains to Damocles that killing a Princess of Elenia would do them no favors.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles apologizes and turns to help the rest to their feet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and the others explain that they are from Elenia and on an important mission.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Seeing the princess in his cellar, Elias Hyde mistakenly believes that Nightingale and her friends must be the official help that his family fetched for from Elenia.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and the others don’t know about any sort of official requested help from the capital, but they nod anyway, playing along.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SURI WAS RIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SURI WAS RIGHT

Sparknotes.TITLE: SURI WAS RIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Saving Isla from the Celestial Gigas proves to be a double-edged sword. Due to the amount of time spent fighting, the doctor isn’t able to save Faust and he dies in the hospital.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SURI WAS RIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Overtaken with grief, Isla storms out of the Hyde hospital and disappears into Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SURI WAS RIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group turns their attention back to the task at hand, hoping that Isla will be okay.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SURI WAS RIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !New Story Flag: Heartbroken Exile.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TEEMING WITH MONSTERS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TEEMING WITH MONSTERS

Sparknotes.TITLE: TEEMING WITH MONSTERS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice assures the party that they are almost to the explosion site. She apologizes for the infestation of creatures and explains that while the presence of many are directly her fault for opening up the walls, the Blighted Guardians shouldn’t have been down here regardless. The human’s she ran into were likely behind the presence of the Blighted Guardians.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TEEMING WITH MONSTERS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They finally reach the wide cavern that Justice had been leading them toward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TEEMING WITH MONSTERS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook hopes that all the death they’ve been dealing will have thinned out the infestation and help the guards in the future.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TEEMING WITH MONSTERS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles thanks them again for their help and hopes that all this work can save his mother.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TELL ME THE TRUTH

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles chauffeurs the party down from the manor and into the streets of Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Unbeknownst to the Nightingale and her friends, Damocles has researched the real adventuring party from Elenia that was supposed to arrive and give aid in Hyde. They were supposed to be seafaring pirates lead by a large man named Kajax.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles knows their story is fake and angrily confronts Nightingale while out of the earshot of his father. Damocles demands to know who they really are and what they want from him and his father.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is forced to tell the truth as the tension peaks. Damocles is hot headed, and Rook worries that a fight might break loose.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles is calmed down when Nightingale admits who she is and why she’s there. She catches Damocles up briefly, then explains that they are looking for a Theodotion mage.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles chastises them for lying to him and his father. Regardless, he feels that their intentions are genuine. Damocles figures that as long as they are willing to help him with his mother’s situation and find the true culprit behind The Blight, he doesn’t care why they are here. More importantly, Damocles explains that he knows nothing of a Theodotion mage. However, if this fabled Theodotion was powerful enough to collapse a large section of the Hyde Mines, then it may be related to the explosion that occurred a few days ago.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale begins to inquire to learn more, but Damocles cuts her short and explains that they’re going to see the jailer. He tells Nightingale that her questions would be better asked there.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TELL ME THE TRUTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Apparently, Damocles already has a lead that none of them know about.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Now back at the embassy, with Lotus in hand, the party debates on what to do with this sought-after flower.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi has heard about the corpse lotus before. A corpse lotus in pristine condition like the one they’d just retrieved would garner them a handsome return.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook and Zeke both agree. They think that the money would help the group ensure Nightingale’s safety. Afterall, they needed money to make sure that they were properly equipped to get rid of the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale can’t believe that the others are considering taking the Lotus and selling it after promising Teegan Patel that they would help her. She contends that her daughter could have been told about Middara and could be waiting to come to Middara. Remi contends that she might not. Moreover, not everyone wants to be pulled away from their friends and family.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FINANCIAL DILEMMA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Decision: The Adventurer with the Corpse Lotus must decide what to do.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE HYDE ESTATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE HYDE ESTATE

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE HYDE ESTATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The party makes their way up a hill overlooking the city to the walled off Hyde estate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE HYDE ESTATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: At the gates of the manor were two guards that looked more bored than threatening. The guards make it clear that no one is entering the gate behind them. Apparently, as they’ve already been told, the Hyde family is not seeing visitors.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE HYDE ESTATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While the others debate on how to approach the situation, Zeke takes charge and decides to attempt to lie his way in.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE HYDE ESTATE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Skill Check: The rest of his friends play along and Zeke hopes it works.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PROPER AUTHORITIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE PROPER AUTHORITIES

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PROPER AUTHORITIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With Padric escorting Aisling to Elenia proper, Remi and Nightingale rest near a quiet pond and eat lunch. The two watch with enjoyment as Remi’s new cat, Gage, plays on the pond’s edge. The two debate on what Balthazar will do to Aisling as punishment for her crimes. Nightingale suspects the gallows but the outcome could change depending on her father’s mood after his long memorial hunt.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PROPER AUTHORITIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is confident that because herself, Remi, Zeke, and Rook made sure to defer to her father about Aisling’s punishment, that Balthazar will be pleased. If she’s lucky, her father might even reconsider allowing Nightingale into the Demiurge.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE PROPER AUTHORITIES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The two eventually rejoin Rook and Zeke and they continue traveling towards Hyde.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TO THE MINES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TO THE MINES

Sparknotes.TITLE: TO THE MINES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles leads the group to the entrance of the mines. The guards eyeball Justice suspiciously and urge Damocles to be careful. Apparently, since the explosion, the mines were teeming with monsters.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TO THE MINES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles pulls Justice to the front and commands her to lead away. She tiptoes forward and leads the group cautiously into the dark.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE

Sparknotes.TITLE: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group continues on their way towards the city of Hyde in hopes of finding more information about the mythical Theodotion Mage mentioned in Aisling’s stolen documents. As they travel south, and deeper into Elenia’s wild countryside, they marvel at the vast mountainous and unforgiving terrain along the way.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: During the long walk, Rook tries to comfort Nightingale by suggesting that curing her of the Maluma could be as easy as casting a spell.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With hesitation and doubt in her voice, Nightingale tries to cheer herself up.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TRAVELING THE DISTANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward Check: Hegemonix.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TROUBLE OF THE BOND

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a long, treacherous battle, the party stands exhausted, Isla dead at their feet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Faust, clinging to life, accepts Isla’s fate, exclaiming that she won’t be alone for long.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook does his best to help tend to Faust’s devastating wounds but doesn’t have much hope for Faust’s survival.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook asks Suri how Isla got to be on Middara to begin with. He’d always been told that those from Arkalla couldn’t take physical form for long. Suri explains that creatures from different dimensions can create a Soul Bond with each other, allowing them to travel freely between worlds. Faust was Isla’s Soul Bond and this was highly illegal. Although this is usually safe, Suri’s home world of Arkalla is one of the dimensions that is off limits from travel. The Great Bounty are the being that enforce this law and will surely be here soon.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri then notices a dark opening in the sky and dread overcomes her. The agents of The Great Bounty were already here.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Dread overcomes Suri as a dark opening tears into the sky above them. An agent of the Great Bounty was already here. Suri wisps away, giving Rook one last desperate look before vanishing in fear at the newcomer.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Descending from the skies, a massive lion-like creature, three stories tall with flowing feathery wings like something out of the book of Revelations lands nearby.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The beast introduces itself as an agent of the Great Bounty. Promising that it means humans no harm. Instead, the creature congratulates them for bringing it lawbreakers. First, it turns on the Living Oblation. The red headed girl with the scythe struggles with her injuries and crawls in a vain attempt to escape.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Lion-Beast leans down over the squirming Living Oblation. The red headed girl screams out as the Lion-Beast tears the human vessel into pieces, exposing the creature that was habitating the human body. It explodes out of the carcass like a black ooze, similar to the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale covers her mouth in horror at the idea of the monster tearing her apart to get at the Maluma within herself. Somewhere deep within her, she feels the Maluma shrink and disappear as though it too was fearful of the monster.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TROUBLE OF THE BOND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Lion-Beast is disappointed when he sees Isla’s still dead body. The agent of the Great Bounty explains that they only offer payment for fugitives that are delivered alive. Then, he tosses a cloth sack filled with gold for their delivery of the Living Oblation. Finally, the Lion-beast tears open a pocket of reality itself, revealing a portal to some place far beyond. The Lion-beast nods to the party before walking through and snapping the portal shut behind him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A messenger rushes to find Damocles and the others in the city. The message is urgent. Damocles must return to his father. Things are getting worse quickly for Rivka.

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: When they arrive to the estate, they find the servants all dressed in black. They are ushered to a bedroom where they find Elias sitting next to his wife, Rivka. The poor woman looks sick and pale with a green rot spreading down her body. There is a madness in her eyes and it’s clear that she’s no longer completely human.

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Though Damocles protests, Elias refuses to see his wife turn completely into a monster. Even if a cure does exist, he could never live with himself keeping her locked up for the decades it could take until the mythical cure is found.

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The truth is horrific but they both realize what must be done. Rivka must be killed before things get worse.

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma whispers from inside Nightingale, it’s dark voice tells her that Elias is too weak to be the one to kill her. Nightingale can’t believe it, but she agrees with the Maluma. Elias is shaky, and as he pulls a dagger from his side, it’s clear that he’ll emotionally suffer doing the deed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is urged by the Maluma to suggest that Damocles be the one to do the dirty work. Does she trust the Maluma?

Sparknotes.TITLE: UNSTOPPABLE BLIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Decision: Nightingale may choose to either urge Damocles to be the one to kill his mother, or say nothing and let Elias do it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS ROYALTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: VICTORIOUS ROYALTY

Sparknotes.TITLE: VICTORIOUS ROYALTY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and Zeke win the Bellicose fight. Jovial trash-talking ensues.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE COULDN’T SAVE THEM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WE COULDN’T SAVE THEM

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE COULDN’T SAVE THEM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The miners weren’t saved. Regardless, Damocles is congratulated for such a brave selfless act.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE COULDN’T SAVE THEM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice is distraught at the all the death caused by her magic.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE COULDN’T SAVE THEM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: !Flag Check: New Ambitions.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE TRIED OUR BEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WE TRIED OUR BEST

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE TRIED OUR BEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Back at Teegan Patel’s estate, Nightingale apologizes for being unable to retrieve the gilded Lotus and convince Lyle to push the Harbinger documents further into arbitration.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE TRIED OUR BEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Although disappointed, Teegan thanks them for their efforts. She decides to try and find another way to get her daughter to Middara.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE TRIED OUR BEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Teegan departs, letting them know she’s thankful and hopes to meet again one day.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Defeated, and under the impression they mean to kill him, the man angrily tells the group to finish what they came here to do.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale quickly explains who she is. She points out that they entered via a hidden tunnel that was dug outside of the estate. Nightingale tries to explain that they aren’t here to harm anyone. Instead, they are here to gather information.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Just then, a man bursts through the cellar door nearby. Flanked by a set of guards, he calls for his ally by the name of Damocles, worried that he has been hurt by the intruders. The guards surge forward to seize the Nightingale and the others.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles calls to his father, urging him to refrain from arresting anyone. Nightingale helps Damocles stand. Damocles brushes himself off and warns his father that this is the second princess of Elenia, Nightingale Arsen.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles’ father is relieved to hear that they aren’t intruders who mean them harm. He introduces himself as Elias Hyde and explains that he is personal friends with Balthazar. Seeing the Princess in his cellar, Elias mistakenly believes that she and her friends must be some sort of help that he sent for from Elenia.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE’RE NOT HERE TO FIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and the others don’t know about any sort of official help that was requested, but they nod anyway, playing along.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CONFUSED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A CONFUSED SURVIVOR

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CONFUSED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Once Zafir and the Anointed are gone, Ursy emerges from the shadows, wanting to know why they were fighting. In her mind, the Anointed saved her, and they helped save her too, so they should be on the same size.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CONFUSED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and Remi do their best to explain that they can’t stay together. Ursy is troubled, then offers her own help to make up for what’s missing. She has nature magic and that should be able to help with their adventure. She doesn’t have a tribe anymore, so she doesn’t have any reason not to stay with them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CONFUSED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Ursy Companion

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A CURIOUS ROOM

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice is losing steam, worried about the members of the Anointed and the fact that they haven’t encountered anyone else yet despite traveling so far. Zeke reassures her that they’re bound to find them eventually, they just have to keep looking. They have to be down here somewhere.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles calls them over, revealing the entrance to a massive chamber that proves to be their destination. It holds numerous strange arcane objects, preserved from the jungle’s rot thanks to the great depth.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice warns them not to touch anything, as she investigates an ancient tome held in protective glass. She seems excited with the secrets it contains, and hopes to be able to take it back to translate it fully on the surface.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While she’s reading, Damocles ignores her advice and tampers with one of the artifacts, releasing a gigantic tree-monster from within which immediately attacks them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice is unwilling to run, and tries to get past it to the tome, forcing Zeke and Damocles to fight their way after her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A CURIOUS ROOM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTANT SOUND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A DISTANT SOUND

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTANT SOUND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Though he did his best to keep awake and protect Remi, Rook eventually fell asleep.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A DISTANT SOUND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Fortunately Padric was there to pick up the slack, and he’s been watching over them along with Gaige for several hours now. But something moves in the dark, enough to finally attract his attention. He wakes Rook, warning of the attack to come. They have only moments to prepare.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A GEHENNA MORNING

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After surviving the confrontation with Alana, the group joins the Anointed in their old camp. Instead of resting right away, Nightingale meets with Zafir and justice to discuss what has happened.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice retells her experiences searching Hyde and eventually locating the piece of the Pontifex, as well as the death of her previous companions. Zafir assures her that she made the right choice looking for it, and that none of those who died were her fault.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After some discussion, Justice explains that she now understands what the Pontifex actually does. It’s a key, able to seal and unseal esper of all kinds. A supernatural skeleton key.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The injured members of the group are finally able to receive magical treatment, recovering from their wounds.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: All party members are no longer injured

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The next morning, the whole group meets with Zafir again, and Rook asks about the purpose of the Anointed. Zafir explains that the Annointed were formed to oppose a godlike being called Charon, who they now know is attempting to escape using the power of the Pontifex. There seems to be more to their motivations, but Zafir refuses to explain, instead demanding answers about their own motives for helping Justice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before they can tell him the truth, the Maluma reveals itself to Nightingale, warning her frankly that Zafir is one of its old enemies, and if he learns it has infested her, then Zafir will stop at nothing to get it out, even if that means killing her. She stops Rook from telling Zafir about it just in time. Instead she tells Zafir that she’s the princess, and lies about her civic duty.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Once he’s gone, Nightingale explains what the Maluma told her. Rook seems doubtful that Zafir would turn on her after she saved his life. Nightingale leaves to find Justice and ask her how he’ll react.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice confirms that the Maluma was telling the truth, and that Zafir has killed its previous hosts. She seems confident that she’ll be able to make sure this time goes better so long as she makes the case. Nightingale and Zeke are frustrated with her, but she promises to make the case for Nightingale that night.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A GEHENNA MORNING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Book of Gehenna

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HAPPY SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A HAPPY SURVIVOR

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HAPPY SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After the battle is over, Ursy emerges from hiding and is ecstatic to see the group and the Anointed will be joining forces.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HAPPY SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zaphir is happy to have her along, and he assures her that she won’t be expected to fight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HAPPY SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ursy argues that she’s not helpless, and she promises to use her magic to help.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HAPPY SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Reward: Ursy Companion

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HORRIFIC SIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A HORRIFIC SIGHT

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HORRIFIC SIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is emotionally destroyed after seeing the Maluma attack and kill someone, and she collapses uselessly to the ground.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HORRIFIC SIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir rages at her, insisting that he could’ve saved Echo. Nightingale is obviously overcome by the Maluma and needs to die.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HORRIFIC SIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before he can attack, a strange appears in the cavern, apparently after following the group there. It’s Shayliss Arsen, Nightingale’s older sister. She insists that Nightingale did nothing wrong, and was just defending herself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HORRIFIC SIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir takes the surviving Anointed and leaves the cave, enraged that Nightingale won’t be punished.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A HORRIFIC SIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PAINFUL END
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A PAINFUL END

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PAINFUL END
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale tries desperately to escape, crawling away from Alana. For a moment Alana makes her think that she might escape. But she’s just playing with her food—eventually she’s tired of waiting, and lets her Wurm devour her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PAINFUL END
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is conscious long enough to feel the Maluma’s pleasure at acquiring a much more powerful host before she’s killed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PANICKED RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A PANICKED RUN

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PANICKED RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke, Justice, and Damocles are unable to fight the gatekeeper, despite their best efforts. Zeke and Justice do their best to hold her off, getting the crap beaten out of them in the process.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PANICKED RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles eventually discovers a hidden exit, and they sprint desperately to get away, locking the door behind them with Justice’s magic and running for their lives.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PANICKED RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke is upset that they didn’t retreat as soon as the Gatekeeper appears, but it’s too late to flee now. The only way open to them is forward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PROMISE IN DEATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A PROMISE IN DEATH

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PROMISE IN DEATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir finally falls after the other Anointed are killed. In his last moments, he clutches to Nightingale’s arms, proclaiming that Elenia is doomed and that they’ll all die. He reminds Nightingale of her promise, begging her to save Echo.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PROMISE IN DEATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: The Only Way

Sparknotes.TITLE: A PROMISE IN DEATH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of her Coterie

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SAFER PLACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A SAFER PLACE

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SAFER PLACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Together with the Anointed, the group finally defeats Alana. They kill the wurm, severing each of its remaining heads. Eventually Alana is on the ground, crawling away from them. She taunts Nightingale, arguing that she has no right to judge. All Alana wanted was immortality, something that Nightingale already had.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SAFER PLACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma tries to pressure Nightingale into killing her. But before she can give in, Rook intervenes, insisting that Alana is going to die anyway. She isn’t worth it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SAFER PLACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Alana dies on the ground in front of them. Nightingale does her best to comfort Ursy about the loss of her tribe.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SAFER PLACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: Last of her Coterie

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SCARED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A SCARED SURVIVOR

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SCARED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Usry is horrified by the slaughter she saw. She felt loyal towards the Anointed, and seeing them murdered has made her flee and hide in a remote corner of the camp.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SCARED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi finds her, and does her best to reassure her. She comforts the Nymph, explaining that she doesn’t understand either, but they didn’t have another choice. And she doesn’t have to worry about being harmed in their companion.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SCARED SURVIVOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Ursy Companion

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SIGN OF ECHO
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A SIGN OF ECHO

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SIGN OF ECHO
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale finds Zafir going between the tents of the dead members of the Anointed, gathering a single possession from each one to give to their families. They have a brief conversation, and he reiterates the importance of their mission.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SIGN OF ECHO
Sparknotes.CONTENT: During their converseation, the Maluma appears, telling Nightingale it can help them track down Echo’s esper. She gets some distance from him, then asks it to explain.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SIGN OF ECHO
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma demands her body to find Echo, and she refuses. Before things can get desperate, Damocles is able to find Echo’s trail, and the group finally sets off.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SIGN OF ECHO
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SOUL ENSLAVED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A SOUL ENSLAVED

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SOUL ENSLAVED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir leads the way into the cave, determined to be the one to confront Echo.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SOUL ENSLAVED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Sure enough, she’s waiting for them. She begs him to flee, and for the group to retreat, insisting that she won’t be able to stop Charon when he makes her fight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A SOUL ENSLAVED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir refuses, insisting that they need the Pontifex piece back, and can’t leave without it. They delay long enough that the Soul Stitcher finally arrives, jerking Echo into motion. If they want the Pontifex Piece, they’ll have to take it by force.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A STRANGE ENCOUNTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A STRANGE ENCOUNTER

Sparknotes.TITLE: A STRANGE ENCOUNTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After searching Gehenna for some time, the group eventually comes upon the Great Library, a massive overgrown structure slowly crumbling away. As they reach the entrance, they encounter a figure emerging from inside, and they can tell she isn’t human.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A STRANGE ENCOUNTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The figure turns out to be peaceful, introducing herself as Lakshimi the Gatekeeper. She is a traveling merchant, and she’s eager to trade.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A STRANGE ENCOUNTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She warns the group to avoid her sisters, because they’re unlikely to be peaceful.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TIRING MEETING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A TIRING MEETING

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TIRING MEETING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group flees into the swamps until they’re sure they aren’t being followed. Conditions are terrible and dangerous and they’re all exhausted by the time they find somewhere safe to catch their breath.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TIRING MEETING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is furious with herself, though Rook seems cautiously willing to believe what Zafir said about the Maluma’s goals. Maybe it really is trying to free an evil god, and they could be playing into its desires.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TIRING MEETING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale argues that she isn’t a slave to its commands. It does talk to her and try to manipulate her, but she’s still in control.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TIRING MEETING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri appears, urging the group to retreat from the swamps and gather allies. They ignore her, instead deciding to rest for a bit until the Anointed are asleep, then try to sneak into camp to rescue their friends.

Sparknotes.TITLE: A TIRING MEETING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: ALL MY FRIENDS ARE DEAD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ALL MY FRIENDS ARE DEAD

Sparknotes.TITLE: ALL MY FRIENDS ARE DEAD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The fight to recover the seeds goes badly, and they’re all destroyed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ALL MY FRIENDS ARE DEAD
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ursy seems unwilling to go on, viewing herself as having failed completely. Nightingale assures her that Breeze wouldn’t want her to give up, and she reluctantly agrees. Breeze follows them back to the city, silent the whole way back.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AMBUSH FAILED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: AMBUSH FAILED

Sparknotes.TITLE: AMBUSH FAILED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group defeats a large number of dangerous wildlife that has built nests in the ruins.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AMBUSH FAILED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma is showing Nightingale strange visions while within the ruins, and Remi tells her that she should ignore them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OLD FRIEND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: AN OLD FRIEND

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OLD FRIEND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss is shocked to find the group, and even more surprised to find Padric is with them of all places. She demands to know what he’s doing there, and why he didn’t send Nightingale back to Elenia.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OLD FRIEND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric explains that he met up with her in Rhamsted, and he could tell she would need help, so he decided to come along.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OLD FRIEND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale asks how Shayliss was able to find them, and Shayliss explains that she sent a crew to help in Hyde, but when they’d arrived they discovered Nightingale and her friends had already been there. She’d been following them ever since.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OPPORTUNE TIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: AN OPPORTUNE TIP

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OPPORTUNE TIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is relieved to reunite with her sister, and they share a tearful embrace.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AN OPPORTUNE TIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group wants to know how she was able to find them, and Shayliss explains that she has been tracking them ever since Nightingale left Elenia. They figure out that she met Padric, though he isn’t traveling with her anymore.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Everyone except Nightingale plummets down the trap. There’s a chute at the end, so no one is killed in the fall. Even so, Remi breaks one of her wings. Rook volunteers to carry her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri appears, warning everyone that she can feel traps placed in the ruins, which shouldn’t be there. Someone has made changes to the city since it was abandoned.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice is worried about the fate of the Anointed, and rallies everyone to find them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Remi is injured.

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Nightingale is

Sparknotes.TITLE: AT LEAST WE FELL TOGETHER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Rook is

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACK TICKET REDEMPTION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: BLACK TICKET REDEMPTION

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACK TICKET REDEMPTION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before Alana can kill her, a dozen Black Hand agents appear from the shadows with crossbows and magic. They unleash everything they have against Alana, tearing her apart in seconds.

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACK TICKET REDEMPTION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: When the smoke clears, their leader helps Remi from the rubble, and informs them that their debt has been repaid. They take back the black ticket, burning it before their eyes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACK TICKET REDEMPTION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir wants to know who they are, and Remi explains a little of what happened in Rhamsted. Considering their results, Zafir is thrilled they arrived in time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: BLACK TICKET REDEMPTION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Special: Remove Black Ticket

Sparknotes.TITLE: CAGES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: CAGES

Sparknotes.TITLE: CAGES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale wakes bruised and bloody, discovering that she’s trapped inside a cage. She isn’t alone though: the members of the Anointed they’ve been looking for are all around her. A man introduces himself as Zafir, and explains how futile their escape attempts have been. Breeze is trapped too, along with the only surviving Nymph, Ursy.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CAGES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma instantly recognizes Zafir, and stops waiting passively for Nightingale to be killed. It grants her new powers in order to cut through the bars and lead an escape. The Anointed see her do it, though considering how desperate the situation is they don’t press her for answers right then.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CAGES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: The Feasting Discipline

Sparknotes.TITLE: CAGES
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: Slipping +1

Sparknotes.TITLE: CITY IN THE SWAMPS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: CITY IN THE SWAMPS

Sparknotes.TITLE: CITY IN THE SWAMPS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group finally reaches Gehenna, an ancient stone city that has been completely overgrown by the swamp on all sides. Justice uses her tome to show everyone a picture of what it looked like before being abandoned, and the non-human population that lived there.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CITY IN THE SWAMPS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice meets Suri for the first time, who emerges to explain that her own species built the city long ago. At the same time, the group discovers that Suri and her kind are not immortal. Only humans don’t age.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CITY IN THE SWAMPS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group reaches the center of the city, and encounter the Anointed camp. It has been completely abandoned, probably for several days. Justice explains that the Anointed are devoted to fighting a cabal of godlike beings called the Council of Abhorrence, which Suri doesn’t believe exist.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CITY IN THE SWAMPS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a search, Rook discovers crude maps of the city leading to the library, which Justice believes Zafir must’ve written. The group decides to follow them, and hopefully find the Anointed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL

Sparknotes.TITLE: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group discovers why Alana was such a threat to the Annointed as they’re beaten to a bloody pulp. The former Nymph discovers Justice, the reason they were able to bypass so many of her traps. She’s going to feed her to her Wurm first.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before she can, Damocles distracts the beast long enough for them to escape down a side-passage, barring it behind them. Alana begins to break down the door in rage, before yelling something about an attack on her lair, and abandoning her attempt to kill them for the moment.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group limps back to their camp in the library, discovering Nightingale is missing.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook wants to return to the ruins to find her, but is outvoted by everyone else. They’re barely standing after their fight, they need time to treat their wounds and recover from all the fighting. They can go get Nightingale once they’ve had a little time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CLUMSY WITHDRAWAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: [[error in print, missing flag to check on page 275]]

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRACKED FAÇADE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: CRACKED FAÇADE

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRACKED FAÇADE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They do their best against Echo, but she’s just too powerful. She doesn’t seem to care much about Nightingale and the rest of the group though, taking sadistic pleasure in killing the Anointed one at a time. This lets the group crawl away, though she’d probably come for them next if her slaughter continued.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRACKED FAÇADE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir begs her to stop, and finally manages to get her attention. For a few moments they meet in silence, and she seems to become lucid again for a moment. She explains that she’s been enslaved, that the Stitcher is in her mind, forcing her to do its will. She wants desperately to escape, but even when she dies it only brings her back.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRACKED FAÇADE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Mention of the Pontifex attracts the Esper’s attention. Now that she’s taken the pontifex piece, it drags her away into the swamp, leaving them behind.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRASHING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: CRASHING

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRASHING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice leads the group back towards the surface, frustrated at having to wait on the new information she’s gathered in the library.

Sparknotes.TITLE: CRASHING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before they can use the exit, Alana arrives riding her Lich Wurm, blocking the exit. She informs them that they’ve fallen into her traps and now they’ll be food for her creature, mocking their attempts to stop her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DANGEROUS SPLIT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: DANGEROUS SPLIT

Sparknotes.TITLE: DANGEROUS SPLIT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They don’t stay still for long. Zeke suggests that the group should split in half, with himself, Justice, and Damocles going down into the Gehenna library while Padric and Rook keep an eye on Remi.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DANGEROUS SPLIT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Once everyone is convinced, Justice leads half the group away, down into the archives.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEEPER INTO THE LIBRARY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: DEEPER INTO THE LIBRARY

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEEPER INTO THE LIBRARY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After wandering for some time, the group comes to a dead end covered in strange symbols.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEEPER INTO THE LIBRARY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke asks if Suri knows how to translate them, but she says it’s much too ancient and she can’t be of any help. She explains that Arkalla is a vast realm with many creatures, including her own kind the Antargatis Siren. They don’t know everything every other species ever built.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEEPER INTO THE LIBRARY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice remembers that another Arkallan creature, a Nixie named Bexley, was advising the Anointed. She decides to try her tome, and with it she activates the spell on the door.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DEEPER INTO THE LIBRARY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: It opens, revealing a dead member of the Anointed, Jakobe, who had been trapped there. Justice is upset she couldn’t be there to save him. The group collects his valuables and continues forward.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DON’T FIGHT, JUST RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: DON’T FIGHT, JUST RUN

Sparknotes.TITLE: DON’T FIGHT, JUST RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group is completely overwhelmed by the monsters that have infested the ruins. Eventually they’re forced to run for their lives. Padric carries Remi for a bit to allow Rook to cover their retreat.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DON’T FIGHT, JUST RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi apologizes for causing them to fail, feeling that she’s the reason they’re unable to fight. Rook dismisses her fears, insisting that she shouldn’t feel guilty for being hurt.

Sparknotes.TITLE: DON’T FIGHT, JUST RUN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually they find a path forward, and proceed deeper into the library.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ECHO FROM THE PAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ECHO FROM THE PAST

Sparknotes.TITLE: ECHO FROM THE PAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Meanwhile, Justice and Zeke have been beaten and restrained outside the Anointed camp. While Justice waits for Zafir’s judgement, she notices a figure approaching from the jungle. At first she hopes it might be their rescue, but the one who emerges is Echo, fully healed. She doesn’t alert the Anointed to her arrival, hoping that she might be willing to let them free.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ECHO FROM THE PAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Instead, Echo puts her knife to Justice’s neck, demanding that she tell her where the Pontifex piece has been taken. Justice refuses, and would be killed, except that Zeke starts throwing rocks. Before Echo can finish what she’s doing, the commotion rouses the Anointed, who rush in to see what’s going on.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ECHO FROM THE PAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir is amazed to see Echo there, and is almost unwilling to believe she could even be alive. Echo begs him to give her the Pontifex piece and let her go, since she doesn’t want to hurt him. But Zafir refuses, insisting that keeping it from Charon is more important than anything.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ECHO FROM THE PAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually her Esper arrives, forcing her to fight. Zafir is unwilling to lift his weapon against her, but the other Anointed rush to his defense.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ECHO FROM THE PAST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING 4: DIED A KILLER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ENDING 4: DIED A KILLER

Sparknotes.TITLE: ENDING 4: DIED A KILLER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is forced to watch as the Anointed kill her friends one at a time. When they’re dead, the Anointed throw Nightingale into another spell circle, and perform the same spell as before. This time Justice isn’t there to free her from it. She’s trapped beside her dead friends, to wait for the Great Bounty to find and kill her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ! GAME OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! GAME OVER

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FINDING JUSTICE

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group leaves the caves behind, catching Shayliss up on what they’ve been through in the meantime. They insist that they must save Justice, because of the piece of the Pontifex she has.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss explains just how difficult that task will be. If Justice is in the lair of a Shadow Lord, they’ll be up against a demigod of death, in a realm it controls. They are unlikely to survive the trip.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss has a map, and directs them out of the swamps, where they can catch an Airship to take them closer to the Shadow Lord, and Justice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Justice is unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: All injured party members are restored

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Party Member: Shayliss

Sparknotes.TITLE: FINDING JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Massacred

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOOTSTEPS AND BARE FEET
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FOOTSTEPS AND BARE FEET

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOOTSTEPS AND BARE FEET
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Though the gatekeepers are dangerous enemies, Nightingale and the Anointed are able to overwhelm them. As the last is finally destroyed, the nymphs begin searching through the corpses for any sign of their tribe. Breeze and Ursy are on the edge of a breakdown.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FOOTSTEPS AND BARE FEET
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir urges them to make their escape now, or else be discovered by Alana and die too. Together they make their escape, limping free of Alana’s lair.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FROM THE SHADOWS

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Despite their boldness in judging against Zafir, the battle goes badly. The Anointed were much more powerful than the group thought, and they’re defeated. Nightingale is beaten onto the ground and is soon to be killed. She overhears Zafir ordering them to kill the rest of the group so Balthazar can’t discover who killed them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Brea is slow to respond, and as Zafir turns to investigate, he’s blasted with dozens of crossbow bolts from the jungle. After just a few seconds, he falls dead.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Black Hand emerge from the darkness, taking the Black Ticket they received and proclaiming the favor repaid.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Remove Black Ticket

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: The Only Way

Sparknotes.TITLE: FROM THE SHADOWS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of the Coterie

Sparknotes.TITLE: FUMBLING ALONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: FUMBLING ALONG

Sparknotes.TITLE: FUMBLING ALONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The ruins are badly infested, and what’s worse they’ve been filled with dangerous traps. The group is overwhelmed, and is beaten into a corner.

Sparknotes.TITLE: FUMBLING ALONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook is forced to put Remi down and fight desperately, clearing a path for the group to drag themselves out. They have no choice but to flee deeper into the library.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: GONE STILL

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a difficult battle, the group defeats Echo, and weakens the Esper enough that it is forced to flee.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She demands to know where Zafir is gone, and Nightingale tells her that he’s dead. This enrages her even more, and she seems likely to attack. Justice takes the Pontifex piece from Echo.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles kills her, but doesn’t get to enjoy his revenge for long before the Stitcher returns and brings her back to life before their eyes. This attracts the Esper’s attention fully, and it attacks Justice, apparently swallowing her completely.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma appears to confront her, furious that the Pontifex piece has been destroyed. Echo informs them that Justice isn’t dead, but that the Stitcher transported her somewhere terrible, the lair of a Shadow Lord.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Stitcher drags Echo out through the ceiling, and the group is unable to follow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As they make to leave, another person arrives to confront them—Shayliss Arsen has found them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GONE STILL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRIMACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: GRIMACE

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRIMACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The fight against the Gatekeepers doesn’t go well for Nightingale, Breeze, and the other hostages. Wore, the Gatekeepers weren’t even trying to kill her, just slow her down.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRIMACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She soon learns why, as Alana arrives riding her Wurm, rampaging through the room and rendering any escape attempt futile.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRIMACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: At the last moment, she ends up with the single surviving Nymph prisoner in her arms, Ursy. Breeze begs her to get the nymph to safety, before sacrificing herself to buy them enough time to escape.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRIMACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and the surviving Anointed run for their lives, not wasting her sacrifice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GRIMACE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: Fallen Friend

Sparknotes.TITLE: GUIDANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: GUIDANCE

Sparknotes.TITLE: GUIDANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric leads the group along the trail. During the trip, he shares a somber conversation with Nightingale over the difficulties of responsibility.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GUIDANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale wants to know if Padric thinks she made the right choice about Zafir.

Sparknotes.TITLE: GUIDANCE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: He assures her that Shayliss would be proud of her efforts, and that leadership is really about weathering things to the end.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOPE FOR A FUTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: HOPE FOR A FUTURE

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOPE FOR A FUTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a difficult battle, Ursy eventually gathers up the seeds, packing them away in a safe, dry container for transport. She can’t stay to raise them, so she’s going to bring them along.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOPE FOR A FUTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ursy expresses her gratitude towards the group for helping her, proclaiming that Breeze knew how to pick good friends, and she would’ve been lost without them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOPE FOR A FUTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They leave together, with Ursy carefully sheltering the seeds from here on.

Sparknotes.TITLE: HOPE FOR A FUTURE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: Seeds of Her People

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL REPAY YOU ONE DAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: I’LL REPAY YOU ONE DAY

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL REPAY YOU ONE DAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Alana and the wurm are eventually defeated, through a difficult battle with everyone working together. After the wurm is dead, Alana retreats, begging Breeze to let her live. This only enrages the Nymph, who uses her magic to finally finish her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL REPAY YOU ONE DAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The others celibrate, but for Breeze and Ursy the victory is bittersweet. Before they retreat into the jungle, they give Nightingale a Homemade Brooch, which Breeze proclaims is a token meant to commemoriate her debt to Nightingale.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL REPAY YOU ONE DAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Reward: Homemade Brooch

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL START WITH THE WEAKEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: I’LL START WITH THE WEAKEST

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL START WITH THE WEAKEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Alana and the Wurm are so powerful that even fighting together she can’t be beaten. Once they’ve all been beaten down so badly that they can’t fight, Alana discovers that one of her tribe is still there. She mocks Ursy, before feeding her to the Wurm.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL START WITH THE WEAKEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is forced to watch as Ursy is eaten alive. Alana turns on Justice next, but before she can kill her, Nightingale finds the energy to keep fighting, and tries to attack her again. But she doesn’t have the strength to put up much of a fight, and all she manages to do is make herself the monster’s next target.

Sparknotes.TITLE: I’LL START WITH THE WEAKEST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Reward Check: Black Ticket

Sparknotes.TITLE: INDEPENDENT BRAVERY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: INDEPENDENT BRAVERY

Sparknotes.TITLE: INDEPENDENT BRAVERY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Breeze leads Nightingale directly to Alana’s lair, past the remains of many dead creatures. She laments the death of her tribe, which Alana has almost completely butchered by now. The Maluma warns Nightingale that the path they’re on is extremely dangerous, but Breeze insists that Alana will be out looking for her newly gathered prey, and while she’s doing that they can free anyone trapped in her lair.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INDEPENDENT BRAVERY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually they reach it, packed with cages of those Alana has trapped. But it isn’t unguarded; another hostile gatekeeper is waiting for them, and she attacks.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IS EVERYONE ALRIGHT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: IS EVERYONE ALRIGHT?

Sparknotes.TITLE: IS EVERYONE ALRIGHT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group falls down the trapdoor, landing roughly. Several party members suffer minor injuries, but Remi is hurt badly enough that she can’t walk. Rook says that he’ll be able to carry her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IS EVERYONE ALRIGHT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri appears to warn everyone that there shouldn’t be traps in the library. Someone has been making changes, and they know the city well enough to be dangerous.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IS EVERYONE ALRIGHT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Remi is injured.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IS EVERYONE ALRIGHT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Nightingale is unselectable.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T THAT LONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: IT WASN’T THAT LONG

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T THAT LONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The rest of the group returns to find that though Rook and Padric were able to defend Remi, Rook was seriously injured in the fighting and is now barely functional himself.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T THAT LONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They learn what Justice, Zeke, and Damocles acomplsihed in the archives, and Justice reveals that she now understands the purpose of the Pontifex. They need to get back together with Nightingale right away.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T THAT LONG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Rook is injured.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S US OR HIM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: IT’S US OR HIM

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S US OR HIM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is convinced that killing Zafir is the right choice. The Maluma wants him alive so badly that it must be the optimal choice. If he stays, he’ll try to kill her, but if he leaves he’ll rally the Anointed to keep hunting them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S US OR HIM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke argues against it, insisting that Zafir is unarmed and there’s no way they can possibly kill him, then they’d be no better than he is. Justice agrees, insisting that Zafir doesn’t have to die.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S US OR HIM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: But Nightingale passes judgement anyway. Even so, when she’s about to do it, she’s unable to swing her sword. Zafir can see this, and agrees to make the process easier on her in exchange for a favor. He asks her to save Echo. Nightingale agrees, and the battle begins.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S US OR HIM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Justice is Unselectable.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S US OR HIM
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Nightingale must be part of the active group.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET’S GET OUT OF HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LET’S GET OUT OF HERE!

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET’S GET OUT OF HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Gehenna has become overrun with dangerous creatures, and they’re far too numerous for the group to defeat. They’re forced to flee for their lives, running wildly into the depths to get away.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET’S GET OUT OF HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is overcome by the Maluma, which exposes her to powerful visions and prompts her to run from her friends.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET’S GET OUT OF HERE!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi eventually catches up with her and comforts her. Even so, her mental state is fading fast.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA

Sparknotes.TITLE: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Together they get the library open, and Nightingale leads the way. She briefly struggles against the Maluma, which is manipulating her into seeing things that aren’t there.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale realizes that a small female figure she sees lurking in the corner is real, and she warns Nightingale to leave. Before she can ask for an explanation, the figure darts away.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group discovers evidence that the Anointed passed through the library, and they set up camp for the evening in the same place.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While the others are getting things ready, Zeke discovers some valuable loot hanging from the ruins. It’s booby-trapped, and everyone but Nightingale vanishes down a trapdoor.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LIBRARY OF GEHENNA
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LOST LOVE

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a terrible battle, Zafir and the group defeat the Soul Stitcher, damaging it so badly that it is forced to retreat. Echo is injured as well, but not slain. She drops, and Zafir tries to help treat her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles confronts Zafir, insisting that the time has come to get justice for his mother’s murder. Zafir refuses to let him harm Echo, insisting that she’s only a victim, and Charon is the one to blame for her murder. After an argument, he eventually backs down.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice takes the Pontifex piece from Echo, insisting that it’s insurance against Zafir attacking them again.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma tries to force Nightingale to take the piece for herself, but she is able to resist. She realizes that splitting up the Pontifex means that the Maluma can’t win by just controlling her, and so she lets Justice take it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before they can even finish treating Echo, let alone interrogating her, the Soul Stitcher returns, appearing so abruptly that no one is able to react. It attacks, aiming for the group around Echo to reclaim its puppet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Echo shoves Zafir out of the way, but Justice isn’t so lucky, and she vanishes into the creature. This was Echo’s plan all along, as she reveals that Justice has been sent away with the Pontifex piece to somewhere her master can’t get it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before the group can attack her, the Soul Stitcher realizes it has been tricked, and drags her away in fury, breaking several of her bones to get her out a narrow opening in the ceiling.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: A newcomer appears at the cave entrance, apparently someone who followed the group just like they followed Echo. It’s Shayliss Arsen, Nightingale’s older sister.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST LOVE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After a day to recover, the group gathers together for dinner in the old camp. Justice makes her way over, trailing behind an agitated Zafir and the rest of the anointed. Zafir is furious with Nightingale, explaining that she’s lied about the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma begs Nightingale to run right then, telling her that Zafir is going to try to kill her, but Nightingale refuses to listen to it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice does her best to stick up for her, reminding Zafir that Nightingale put herself in danger to free the anointed, and that she’s obviously on their side.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before the rest of the group can react, Zafir springs a trap around Nightingale, trapping her and the others inside a shield. He intends to leave them there until the Great Bounty arrives, to kill Nightingale and then destroy the Maluma for good.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir apologizes for having to do it, believing Nightingale dead a long time ago, and everything that she’s done since the work of the Maluma trying to trick them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After failing to convince him to let them go, Justice blasts the trap with her Theodotian magic, tearing it apart and freeing the group inside. She’s forced to flee into the jungle from the Anointed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke runs after her, while the rest of the group retreats another way.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Justice is Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAIN QUEST: A DANGEROUS SITUATION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Zeke is Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Though the group does their best to retrieve the missing key, the swamp’s monsters are just too much for them to overcome, and they’re forced to retreat back to Gehenna.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi apologizes, suggesting that they did their best.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Lakshmi thanks them for trying, suggesting that it’s more than most humans have ever done for her anyway. She’s fairly sure it wasn’t the key to her destiny anyway, but someone else’s.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As a reward for trying to help, she removes a cat’s collar from her stock, offering it to Remi for Gage.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAYBE WE CAN PICK THE LOCK
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Gage’s Collar

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEANINGFUL LOSS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MEANINGFUL LOSS

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEANINGFUL LOSS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The tree-monster is just too powerful to overcome, and Zeke is nearly killed by its attacks. Justice is knocked out before she can reach the tome. Zeke makes his way over, rousing her so that they can try to escape.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEANINGFUL LOSS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice resists, unwilling to leave without the book, and he has to drag her out rather than leave her to die.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEANINGFUL LOSS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Once they escape, Justice has a moment to recover, and apologizes for almost getting them killed. Though dejected over not collecting this new book of knowledge, she’s still confident she knows the purpose of the Pontifex, so maybe it wasn’t all for nothing.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEANINGFUL LOSS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Rested

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEANINGFUL LOSS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEW REVELATIONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NEW REVELATIONS

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEW REVELATIONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Justice shows Nightingale the tome she managed to extract form the archive, convinced that the secrets it contains will allow her to eventually kill the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEW REVELATIONS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Portent of Brutality Discipline

Sparknotes.TITLE: NIGHTINGALE ALONE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NIGHTINGALE ALONE

Sparknotes.TITLE: NIGHTINGALE ALONE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale stands at the edge of the trapdoor, and nearly jumps in after her friends. But the Maluma persuades her that the fall is much too risky, and so she decides to wait for her friends to return.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NIGHTINGALE ALONE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She rests uneasily in the empty camp, until the library begins to shake itself apart. A strange nymph appears from the darkness, saying that something has triggered her trap. Nightingale demands the return of her friends, and the Nymph responds that she can die like them too.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NIGHTINGALE ALONE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is about to fight her, when a massive monster tunnels from the ground behind the nymph, a terrifying predatory wurm. The Maluma tries to coax her into fighting it. She narrowly escapes being eaten alive, until another nymph appears to rescue her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NIGHTINGALE ALONE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The friendly Nymph is called Breeze, and she reveals the Nymph trying to kill her friends is Alana, a former forest nymph who killed or captured all of Breeze’s former tribe. She believes she has done the same to Nightingale’s friends, capturing them for her mount to devour.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NIGHTINGALE ALONE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After some deliberation, they agree to work together to rescue whoever they can, and Breeze leads Nightingale down another path through Gehenna.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma is pleased to see that Nightingale is making the most sensible choice. Nightingale does not react well to this praise. Damocles is even more upset, and probably would’ve attacked if Rook didn’t hold him back. He thinks Zafir deserves to die just for letting Echo free.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir thanks Nightingale for her mercy, and apologizes for suggesting that she didn’t have any of her willpower left. He makes to leave with Justice, but she refuses. She’s unwilling to come with him after the murders he’s committed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before leaving, Zafir requests that Nightingale do her best to save Echo. She’s in the same position, and deserves compassion. She agrees.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: Irreconcilable Differences

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT A KILLER OR A FOOL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of her Coterie

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Though the fight was incredibly difficult, Zeke, Damocles, and Justice are able to overcome the tree-monster and recover the massive book.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke is upset that they didn’t go back for help, but Justice insists they made the right choice. Her book is the entire reason the Anointed came to these ruins, and the knowledge inside might save Nightingale.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Book of Gehenna

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Rested

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE GIRL, TWO BOOKS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After fighting the Grotesque Effigy, the group returns to Lakshmi with the keys she was missing. Remi returns them proudly, asking if they’re the keys to her destiny.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Lakshmi inspects them, then says they’re Zeke’s. She buries the key, and removes an object hidden in her stash: an enchanted chalice. She says that it’s Zeke’s destiny, and she wouldn’t keep him from it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As a reward for her help, she also gives Remi a cat’s collar, with Gage’s name already etched into it. Remi asks how she can possibly have it, but Lakshmi only shrugs.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Chalice of Manala

Sparknotes.TITLE: ONE KEY FOR ONE DOOR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Gage’s Collar

Sparknotes.TITLE: OPPORTUNE AMBUSH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: OPPORTUNE AMBUSH

Sparknotes.TITLE: OPPORTUNE AMBUSH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As they approach the location of camp, Padric climbs up high with a spyglass to see what’s going on. At first he can’t see anything useful in the camp itself, but eventually he can see Echo’s Esper rising above the trees.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OPPORTUNE AMBUSH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They make their way in easily, since all the guards are now fighting Echo. By the time they arrive, the discover Echo easily holding her own against the Anointed. For a moment they seem unsure of what to do, but Padric insists they should help the Anointed. At least they can be reasoned with—they can decide what to do after Echo has been defeated.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OVERWHELMING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: OVERWHELMING
