Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group is unwilling to turn around. They must save Justice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: INTO THE EARTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually they reach a massive opening in the earth, with a glowing stone floating above it. A powerful magic emanates from the stone, creating a barrier down into the ground that they cannot cross. Physical and magical attacks are both deflected without apparent effect.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: IT WASN’T ME!

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They reach the Aegis stone just in time to see a terrible explosion as it’s shattered. After surviving the shockwave, they rush forward in confusion, determined to find Zeke.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They do, but not where they expect. Zeke isn’t anywhere near the stone, but is lying on the ground, badly beaten.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After interrogating him, they learn he’d come with no real hope of opening the Aegis stone, but was confronted by Echo. She beat him senseless, then continued on to destroy the stone and pass into the Eerie.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss insists they return to warn Greyhaven, but Zeke refuses. He’s going to rescue Justice no matter what.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale sides with Zeke, arguging that it will take time for the monsters inside to notice. If they can get Justice out quickly, they can save her and still warn the city.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Zeke is no longer Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT WASN’T ME!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: IT’S MY DECISION

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook watches in horror as the Shadow Lord easily overcomes his friends one at a time. They fought hard, but the creature is far too powerful. They obviously never stood a chance. Finally he attracts its attention, before it can start killing them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook points out that the Shadow Lord claimed its word was absolute. It never applied any conditions on the deal, and so they should still be able to take it. He wants to trade his life for Justice’s, and their safe exit from its domain.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord is impressed with his cleverness, and accepts the exchange. Suri emerges to try to talk him out of it, but the odds are stacked against them. They already tired to fight, and failed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook gives her pendant to Nightingale. Suri is furious, and lashes out against the Deathlord without effect, before vanishing.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook begs the group to take good care of Suri now that he’s gone. The Shadow Lord murders him before their eyes, giving them Justice in exchange.

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: A New Owner

Sparknotes.TITLE: IT’S MY DECISION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Rook has died

Sparknotes.TITLE: LEFT BEHIND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LEFT BEHIND

Sparknotes.TITLE: LEFT BEHIND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The battle goes badly, and the group is overwhelmed by the waiting Butchers. Before they can be killed, the coffin finds an exit, and calls for them to follow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LEFT BEHIND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The pixies insist that Zeke must continue fighting, because that’s what loyal knights are supposed to do.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LEFT BEHIND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke insists that it won’t matter, so long as they keep their promise and lead them to Justice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LEFT BEHIND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Flag: Time is of the Essence

Sparknotes.TITLE: LEFT BEHIND
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Random adventurer is Injured

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET ME HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LET ME HELP

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET ME HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling manages to escape her prison, dragging her way to the throne room in the confusion. The guards are caught up with her, but since she hasn’t become violent they don’t actually hurt her yet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET ME HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Aisling demands to be allowed to help defend Greyhaven. She says she’ll risk her life and fight for them, in exchange for a full pardon.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET ME HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They agree to give it to her, if they successfully defend the city.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET ME HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi is outraged, but quickly overpowered. The situation is so desperate that no one wants to give up help they need.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LET ME HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of her Cotorie

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOSING IT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LOSING IT

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOSING IT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale doesn’t want to break her promise to Zafir. Her friends all pressure her to go different ways, some insisting they don’t have time while others wanting to save Echo.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOSING IT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: Nightingale’s player must make a choice

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LOST IN THE EERIE

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook leads the way, though it doesn’t seem like he knows where he’s going more than anyone else.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma speaks to Nightingale, trying to convince her to give up. The trip is far too dangerous. He informs Nightingale of the dangers to them if they’re killed here, that the Shadow Lord will enslave their souls forever if they die.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke discovers bloodstains on the ground, which glow briefly when touched.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While they’re deliberating, a pair of creatures appear in the darkness, a set of adorable pies that greet them like they’re brave adventurers sent to rescue them. They quickly take a liking to Zeke.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke explains their mission, and the pixies respond that they can help with the rescue. They need to get a few things, but it’s on the way to save the girl anyway.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST IN THE EERIE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The rest of the group is doubtful of their trustworthiness, but Zeke insists that they must know where they’re going, and the group follows.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST SOUL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LOST SOUL

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST SOUL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They do their best to fight, but this Soul Butcher is far too strong to overcome. As they begin to lose, Rook drags them away, leaving the monster to focus on Echo.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST SOUL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She is barely able to hold it back for a few moments before it reaches her, cutting her down in seconds.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST SOUL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They watch in horror as she’s devoured before their eyes. Her spirit appears beside her slain body, collapsing onto the floor to weep, inconsolable with grief.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LOST SOUL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Good Riddance

Sparknotes.TITLE: LUCID
Sparknotes.CONTENT: LUCID

Sparknotes.TITLE: LUCID
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After following the Shadow Lord’s instructions, the group reaches a room a little like the kitchen used by the Soul Butchers.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LUCID
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually they come upon Echo, cornered by a gigantic Soul Butcher covered in armor. Echo has clearly been killed several times now, but her Esper keeps putting her back together. Even so, its power seems to be weining.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LUCID
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group debates whether to help. Shayliss doesn’t want to get involved, while Damocles wants to kill Echo himself. Nightingale thinks its much too cruel to leave her to her fate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: LUCID
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKE HIM PAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MAKE HIM PAY

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKE HIM PAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir says that he’s seen gods die before, and this one will be no difference. The Shadow Lord murdered echo, and for that it should die.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKE HIM PAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss argues that it isn’t his choice to make. When Nightingale asks her what to do, she thinks that turning Rook over is the best option to escape alive.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKE HIM PAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ultimately it’s Nightingale’s decision to make.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKE HIM PAY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: Trade Rook, or Refuse.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKING FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MAKING FRIENDS

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKING FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After the game, Zeke snatches the rare card before Effie can get it back. He explains that he’s going to keep the card until she can prove that the Oppressor has become as mighty as the Memnoch.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MAKING FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before she can argue with him, a member of her crew needs her help, and she’s called away, letting Zeke keep the card.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEMNOCH, THE FLYING FORTRESS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MEMNOCH, THE FLYING FORTRESS

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEMNOCH, THE FLYING FORTRESS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While sulking in private to smoke, Zeke encounters the captain of the Oppressor, a young woman named Effie Grand. They argue briefly over the aptness of the ship’s name, with Zeke suggesting such a little ship should have a smaller name.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEMNOCH, THE FLYING FORTRESS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Effie responds that she’s been saving for years, and that each trip allows her to upgrade her ship. She shows off a rare Abraxis card: Memnoch, the Flying Fortress.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MEMNOCH, THE FLYING FORTRESS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They agree to play against the card right there and try their luck.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY ONLY GOAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MY ONLY GOAL

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY ONLY GOAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Though they fight desperately to reach Echo, they can’t get to her in time. The Butcher is just too powerful, even with Zafir and the Anointed fighting at their side.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY ONLY GOAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before they can stop him, the Soul Butcher tears into her, severing Echo from her Esper and slicing her body into pieces.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY ONLY GOAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: As she dies before their eyes, her spirit appears in the air beside her, weeping inconsolably with grief.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY ONLY GOAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord appears to mock them. Zafir begs for Echo’s soul to be released, but the Shadow Lord refuses. After all, her body is being eaten before their eyes. They’ve failed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY ONLY GOAL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Sacrifice

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MY RESPONSIBILITY

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale reluctantly asks Zafir to make the trade. Zafir removes his gear without a word, giving it over one piece at a time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: He shares one last message, explaining that he knew Charon while he was human. He explains that with him dead, stopping him will be Nightingale’s responsibility now. The Maluma isn’t her real enemy, it’s only a pawn.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord kills Zafir in front of them. The Maluma is satisfied to see him die in agony.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The bargain is struck, and the Shadow Lord accepts their payment.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: A Greater Cause

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Zafir has been killed

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY RESPONSIBILITY
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: A Helping Hand

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY TIME HERE IS OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: MY TIME HERE IS OVER

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY TIME HERE IS OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The chamber begins to collapse all around them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY TIME HERE IS OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord explains that the Eerie’s trapped creatures have discovered they’re free, and are heading to Greyhaven for their revenge. It is eager to go and collect souls. The Shadow Lord finally vanishes from before them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY TIME HERE IS OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss urges them to move, before the passage they used collapsed right in front of them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY TIME HERE IS OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale calls for Suri, desperate for anyone who might know another way out.

Sparknotes.TITLE: MY TIME HERE IS OVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: A New Owner

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEXT LIFE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NEXT LIFE

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEXT LIFE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Echo watches in horror as Zafir dies right in front of her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEXT LIFE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale tries to comfort her, though it’s a cold comfort since she was the one to ask for Zafir’s life.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEXT LIFE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Echo remains surprisingly calm, insisting that it’s only the Stitcher that forces her to act the way they’ve known. She doesn’t get violent with them, despite what just happened.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NEXT LIFE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She reminds the group that Zafir didn’t die to save Nightingale, but for something much more important. She reminds them that it’s now their responsibility to stop Charon now that he’s gone.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NO SUCH THING AS GODS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NO SUCH THING AS GODS

Sparknotes.TITLE: NO SUCH THING AS GODS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir immediately takes the lead. He insists that the Anointed have fought more powerful creatures than a Shadow Lord before. Just because it calls itself a god doesn’t mean it is.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT THE FIRST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NOT THE FIRST

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT THE FIRST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir tells the Shadow Lord that he’s seen gods die before. But he turns over his sword, offering to die instead of Rook.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT THE FIRST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale isn’t sure what to do, and she asks Shayliss for advice. Her sister thinks that turning someone over is the best way to escape alive with Justice. There is a good chance the Shadow Lord will kill them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOT THE FIRST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: Trade Zafir, Trade Rook, or Refuse.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NOW OR NEVER

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The coffin’s power is too great, particularly with the group split. They’re beaten to a pulp, and the coffin is about to start killing them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke draws the glowing chalice, waving it around and trying to get it to do anything. Suddenly it does, and they vanish in a flash of light. Suddenly all of them are outside the Eerie.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The coffin reluctantly releases the one it had trapped inside, agreeing that the bargain was kept despite their violence.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Remove Chalice of Manala

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Coffin Buddy

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW OR NEVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Random adventurer from the active group is injured.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW WHAT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: NOW WHAT?

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW WHAT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke leads the way out, but there’s no way to go but back the way they’ve come. They’ll have to fight their way back through the Soul Butcher’s den.

Sparknotes.TITLE: NOW WHAT?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke doubts that they made the right choice by destroying the coffin, but it’s too late now.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ODD FAREWELL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ODD FAREWELL

Sparknotes.TITLE: ODD FAREWELL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss asks the coffin what it will do now that it’s free. It responds that it plans on getting revenge on the ones who got it sealed in the Eerie in the first place.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ODD FAREWELL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She takes a morally superior position, but the coffin is unimpressed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ODD FAREWELL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Before they leave, the pixies explain the key to finding Justice: they need to follow the glowing blood. It’s the safest path to the Shadow Lord’s tomb.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group hastily boards the Oppressor and departs Greyhaven. The battle rages all around them as they make their escape.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale and Zeke share a private farewell, knowing that they’ll now have to go their separate ways. They worry about each of their companions, particularly Justice with all she went through.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Effie interrupts them, calling that they’re about to cross into dangerous territory. The group agrees that they aren’t giving up now, no matter the danger.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Reward: Gain the Second Piece of the Pontifex.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: All Injured party members are no longer Injured.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OFFICIAL AIRSHIP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Justice is no longer unselectable.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OLD FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: OLD FRIENDS

Sparknotes.TITLE: OLD FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss finds Padric beneath the deck, in order to thank him for helping her sister and keeping them alive. They remaniss about the time they adventured together, and discuss their chances against a Shadow Lord.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OLD FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Neither think they’ll have any hope of killing it, and that Justice is already dead.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OLD FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric reminds Shayliss that doing dangerous things comes with being a member of the Arsen family, as evidenced by their flight over the Middle Passage at that moment.

Sparknotes.TITLE: OLD FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of Her Cotorie

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PADRIC’S HELP

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: With Zeke gone, the group needs all the help they can get, and Shaylis goes straight to Padric’s room. He wakes groggily, and they discover he hasn’t been sleeping alone Aisling is with him, and they’ve been intimate.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric is apologetic, and agrees to come along and help, but asks that Remi not have to find out, considering what Aisling almost did to her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss is still just as unhappy, and curses to herself all the way down.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PADRIC’S HELP
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Padric joins the party!

Sparknotes.TITLE: PLEASE HELP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PLEASE HELP!

Sparknotes.TITLE: PLEASE HELP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale calls on Rook’s necklace, summoning Suri. She begs for her help to escape before they’re crushed by the earthquake.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PLEASE HELP!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri is bitter, and suggests that maybe they should all die. But after being reminded that Rook wanted her to help them, she begrudgingly agrees, and leads them out.

Sparknotes.TITLE: POWERFUL MAGIC
Sparknotes.CONTENT: POWERFUL MAGIC

Sparknotes.TITLE: POWERFUL MAGIC
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They arrive at the Aegis stone too late, as they’re close enough to see the explosion as Zafir and the anointed finally penetrate it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: POWERFUL MAGIC
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group rushes forward, and finds that Zafir and the Anointed have already passed down into the Eerie. Shayliss insists they return to warn Greyhaven, but Zeke refuses. He’s going to rescue Justice no matter what.

Sparknotes.TITLE: POWERFUL MAGIC
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale sides with Zeke, arguging that it will take time for the monsters inside to notice. If they can get Justice out quickly, they can save her and still warn the city.

Sparknotes.TITLE: POWERFUL MAGIC
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma tries to persuade Nightingale not to enter, but she ignores it, leading the way down into the depths.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PRINCESS?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PRINCESS?

Sparknotes.TITLE: PRINCESS?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss points out that Rook is Nightingale’s night, not Justice’s. He doesn’t have to die for her, and if he does he won’t be able to protect Nightingale anymore.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PRINCESS?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: He turns to Nightingale, deferring to her decision. She asks her sister for advice, but Shayliss only repeats the stories that a Shadow Lord can’t be killed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PRINCESS?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook says that he’ll sacrifice himself if she asks. He’s ready to obey.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PRINCESS?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: Trade Rook, or Refuse

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROMISE ME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PROMISE ME

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROMISE ME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir is confident they can kill the Shadow Lord if they have to, he’s killed gods before. But he says they don’t have time—saving Justice is more important than any of their lives. They have to keep the Pontifex from Charon. He volenteers to make the trade.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROMISE ME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Echo is heartbroken and furious, trying to convince him to stop. But he refuses—he’s willing to give up his personal happiness if it means success in their mission.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROMISE ME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale asks Shayliss what they should do. Shayliss agrees they should turn someone over to escape safely. But she also says that if it was her decision, she would never leave someone behind.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROMISE ME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: Trade Zafir, Trade Rook, or Refuse

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROTECTING THE PEOPLE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PROTECTING THE PEOPLE

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROTECTING THE PEOPLE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ursy approaches the throne with Abigail. She’s grateful for everything she received, and wants to return the favor.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROTECTING THE PEOPLE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Tyrial accepts her help without question.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PROTECTING THE PEOPLE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Ursy has left the party.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: PUNISHMENT

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir admits to destroying the Aegis stone, and is completely unrepentant.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Tyrial is furious, demanding to know why he would condemn his whole city to die. When Zafir responds that there is much more at stake, Tyrial seems to want to kill him right there.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Abigail stops him, and they have a brief conversation about the sincerity of his beliefs.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Tyrial calls the guards and throws the Anointed into the dungeons, despite Justice’s protests that they did save her and she has the Pontifex piece needed to help Nightingale.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir pleads to be allowed to help, but Tyrial ignores him, and Shayliss won’t speak for him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Imprisoned Anointed

Sparknotes.TITLE: PUNISHMENT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Zafir is imprisoned.

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST FOR JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: QUEST FOR JUSTICE

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST FOR JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After explaining how they got there, Nightingale asks Abigail for a way to temporarily lift the Aegis stone and enter the Eerie, so that they can free Justice and retrieve her part of the Pontifex.

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST FOR JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Tyrial insists this is impossible, explaining that the dragon-slaying mural on their wall depicts the way Lo and Ida obtained it in the first place. They had to travel the Middle Passage, make a pact with a demon, then enter Arkalla and kill a dragon within. It would be impossible to recreate their feat.

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST FOR JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: There is no way to open the way into the Eerie. They ask Zeke if Justice would want to sacrifice the lives of everyone in the city to save herself. He admits that she wouldn’t.

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST FOR JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Abigail tries to reassure Nightingale that they’ll feel better tomorrow, and might be able to figure out what to do then.

Sparknotes.TITLE: QUEST FOR JUSTICE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of Her Cotorie

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook wakes on the floor, after finally being released from the terrible visions. He’s lying next to the broken corpse of the dead coffin.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri is there waiting for him, to comfort him after the vision he’d seen. She insists that she doesn’t care about breaking the rules to take care of him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The others catch him up on what happened, and help him to his feet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook shares that he briefly experienced the memories of the coffin before it was destroyed. The trail they saw earlier is the key to finding Justice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Rook is no longer Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: REAP THE TARES (OUTDOOR)

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook wakes outside, after finally being released from the terrible visions.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri is there waiting for him, to comfort him after the vision he’d seen. The others catch him up on what happened, and help him to his feet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REAP THE TARES (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Rook is no longer Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The rulers of Greyhaven, Abigail and Tyrial, seem to be expecting them. They soon discover why, as Padric is in the throne room, and has told them they would be coming.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They share an awkward introduction, with Abigail and Shayliss seeming tense with one another.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale introduces herself, and confirms what Padric has told them about the Maluma.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi reacts with horror, discovering Aisling in chains standing in a corner of the room, with an escort of guards.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric tries to calm her down, explaining that after Balthazar wasn’t in Elenia, they traveled to Greyhaven. This seems the best place for her to receive her judgement.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is forced to be the one to stop Remi and Aisling from getting into a physical confrontation with each other.

Sparknotes.TITLE: REUNITING WITH FRIENDS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership

Sparknotes.TITLE: ROYAL COMMISSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ROYAL COMMISSION

Sparknotes.TITLE: ROYAL COMMISSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While trapped inside the coffin, Padric is assaulted with visions of a time recently after arriving in Middara. He remembers expecting to work for years on all the royal orders of handmade firearms he’d accepted.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ROYAL COMMISSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: His friends from the Institute arrived—Shaylis, Tyrial, and Abigail. They try to convince him to go adventuring, but he refuses to leave.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ROYAL COMMISSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss offers to get him out, by getting him a contract with the crown. He’s finally free of his workshop, and able to go out and see the world.

Sparknotes.TITLE: ROYAL COMMISSION
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy

Sparknotes.TITLE: SAFE PASSAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SAFE PASSAGE

Sparknotes.TITLE: SAFE PASSAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: When they’re finished shopping, Lakshmi packs up her belongings.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SAFE PASSAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale invites her to come along, worried she’ll be harmed in the Shadow Lord’s lair. She politely declines, explaining that she’s been promised safe passage.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SAFE PASSAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They ask why the Shadow Lord would make a promise like that. Lakshmi doesn’t know, but she trusts the promise.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE TRIED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SHE TRIED

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE TRIED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss explains that they weren’t the ones to destroy the Aegis stone, they went in to try and stop it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE TRIED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Abigail wants to know who it was, but Zafir explains that they’re already dead. They were killed in the Eerie.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE TRIED
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Abigail is unhappy, apparently uninterested in revenge. All that matters is saving the city.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE’S NOT HERSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SHE’S NOT HERSELF

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE’S NOT HERSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: At the back of the group, Zafir and the Annointed speak privately of what is to come.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE’S NOT HERSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ezra wishes for Zafir to admin what they’ll have to do, and that they’ve lost Echo for good, but Zafir refuses to admit this, arguing that the knowledge she has gained could be valuble if they can free her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHE’S NOT HERSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Brea confronts him, insisting that he needs to be ready for the possibility that Echo is lost forever.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHRUG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SHRUG

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHRUG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The blood leads to a massive set of double doors. It opens before them, but there’s no monster on the other side. Lakshmi appears on the other side, greeting them energetically.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHRUG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke asks if they’ll be able to restock while she’s down here, and she happily obliges.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SHRUG
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Restore Adventurers

Sparknotes.TITLE: SO COMFY!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SO COMFY!

Sparknotes.TITLE: SO COMFY!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi remains back with Ursy, watching her amazement at the technology in use in the palace.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SO COMFY!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The girls go together to the palace’s lavish baths, using the luxury to keep back some of their worries. The effect is only partially effective, however, and the horror remains.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SO COMFY!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ursy is at least one source of joy through the night, as she explains tribal life and enjoys things like blankets and beds for the first time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SO COMFY!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Massacred

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SPIRITS

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After traveling for hours, the group leaves the caverns of the Eerie behind, entering ancient stone ruins carved too large for human use.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord arrives, disappointed that they made it so far into the ruins without being killed. They should’ve been killed a dozen different ways, and somehow they avoided the traps. Then it realizes that the Coffin must’ve been helping them, and it hopes that they killed it to steal its wisdom.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord opens a dozen different passages, and the screams of furious dead emerge from each one. An army is coming for them. The spirits surround them in moments, filling the room in preparation to kill them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They don’t stand a chance, they’re going to be slaughtered.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke screams in desperation, accusing the Shadow Lord of being a coward who won’t dare face them in person.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: This seems to work—the Shadow Lord calls off his army, opening only one door of many. It invites them to join it to die, then vanishes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss Chastises Zeke for his stupidity, but he insists it was their only chance. It worked, after all.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Suri appears, begging Rook to turn around. He refuses, and Suri is horrified. She refuses to watch Rook die, and finally vanishes.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They follow the path directly to a throne of bone and corpses. The Shadow Lord waits, along with Justice trapped beside the throne. She’s still alive, somehow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke demands the Shadow Lord return Justice, and he responds with amusement. They’re the first humans to attract its attention in a long time. It offers them a bargain to trade one of their lives for Justice.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook volunteers immediately, and the group tells him to shut up. It’s probably a lie anyway.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord responds in rage, furious that they would imply its word wasn’t good. It insists that all its promises must always be kept. Lying is for lesser creatures. Justice is incredibly valuable, but its willing trade her for one of their worthless lives anyway.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group deliberates, wondering if there’s another way. Zeke suggests they just fight it, but Rook argues. The Shadow Lord is too powerful, he thinks. They’re doomed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss agrees that the Shadow Lord can’t be killed. Damocles is on her side, but Padric would rather die fighting then sell out one of their own.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: All We Can Get

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership AND Helping Hand

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPIRITS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Reluctant Partnership AND Sacrifice

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPLATTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: SPLATTER

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPLATTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is convinced that saving Echo would just take too long. Justice is who they came for, not her.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPLATTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They don’t get away before Echo’s finally slaughtered, and they’re close enough to watch. After being horrificly cut apart, she reappears as a ghostly spirit beside her body.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPLATTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The ghost settles to the floor beside her corpse, hysterical with grief.

Sparknotes.TITLE: SPLATTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Good Riddance

Sparknotes.TITLE: STEEL YOURSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: STEEL YOURSELF

Sparknotes.TITLE: STEEL YOURSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They’re unable to save Echo in time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STEEL YOURSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir is destroyed by his failure, dragging himself along full of guilt and shame at what he was unable to do. The anointed console him, but with little compassion. They believe Echo dug her own grave, it wasn’t Zafir’s fault.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STEEL YOURSELF
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually Zafir catches up with Nightingale. He shares a moment of solidarity with her, thanking her for being willing to fight for Echo despite everything.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP FIGHTING!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: STOP FIGHTING!

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP FIGHTING!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: All of them working together are finally able to kill the Butcher. Echo remains wounded, and the Stitcher is nowhere to be seen. Apparently it can’t reach here to repair her injuries.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP FIGHTING!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Damocles attacks her immediately, determined to kill her at last. Zafir pulls him off, and makes it clear that he’ll kill him if he harms Echo. There’s a tense standoff, before Shayliss points out just how important it is they work together until they escape the Shadow Lord.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP FIGHTING!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Echo agrees, explaining that she couldn’t possibly fight to the Shadow Lord on her own.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP FIGHTING!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They confiscate Echo’s weapons, and she shares a tearful reunion with Zafir.

Sparknotes.TITLE: STOP FIGHTING!
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: A Helping Hand

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE AMARANTHINE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE AMARANTHINE

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE AMARANTHINE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group returns safely to Greyhaven in early evening, and rides a gondola up to the palace high above the city. After introducing themselves to the guards, they’re escorted straight through security.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE AMARANTHINE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They travel up a levitation circle, lifting them out of the palace and into the throne room itself, located highest in the sky.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE AMARANTHINE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They arrive in an elegant throne room, with a massive mural depicting Lo and Ida slaying a dragon. Waiting on their thrones are Abigail and Tyrial.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE AMARANTHINE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE BLACK CORNER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE BLACK CORNER

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE BLACK CORNER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group decides to follow the Shadow Lord’s instructions, knowing that it could be leading them into a trap. But what it said about the path is exactly true, and nothing attacks them along the way.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE BLACK CORNER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Eventually they reach another terrible chamber, which resembles the kitchen they encountered earlier filled with Butchers. Zafir is on the ground inside, wounded, while Brea and Ezra defend him with their lives against an oversized, armored Soul Butcher.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE BLACK CORNER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: It notices them instantly, and turns away from the beleaguered Anointed to attack the group.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE CLEAVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE CLEAVER

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE CLEAVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The pixies lead the group to a door, warning them to be as quiet as possible as they pass through the room beyond.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE CLEAVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They finally get inside, revealing a horrible, bloody kitchen filled with rotting meat.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE CLEAVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi accidentally knocks something over, creating enough noise that soon many creatures are approaching form all directions.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE CLEAVER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The pixies try to get Zeke to abandon the others, but he refuses, and instead they fly away to hide.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE END IS NEAR

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They’re barely able to continue, constantly on the run from an endless wave of creatures trying to kill them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord manifests to mock them again, laughing that it expected them to at least know how to fight.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke leads them to a quiet corner, insisting that the take the opportunity to rest. They need a few minutes of peace before they face the onslaught any more.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: A Random Adventurer is Injured

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! New Story Flag: Time is of the Essence +1

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE END IS NEAR
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Massacred

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FLIGHT TO GREYHAVEN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE FLIGHT TO GREYHAVEN

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FLIGHT TO GREYHAVEN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group approach their chartered ship, ‘The Oppressor,’ and learn the importance of the float core allowing it to fly.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FLIGHT TO GREYHAVEN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale finds a place to herself, and stares off the edge during the flight, down into the ominous canyon below. Before she can get a good look at what is down inside it, Shayliss approaches and shares a spiced drink.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FLIGHT TO GREYHAVEN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Experienced Guide

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FLIGHT TO GREYHAVEN
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Last of her Cotorie

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FOREST AT NIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE FOREST AT NIGHT

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FOREST AT NIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale is nervous to travel through the forest at night, and is worried about the trouble Zeke will get into by himself. She realizes that their group is being loud enough to attract many dangers.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FOREST AT NIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss insists that they can’t slow down, or else Zeke might beat them to the Aegis stone. They can’t risk the possibility that he’ll open it somehow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE FOREST AT NIGHT
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They don’t make it much further before their noisy passage finally attracts the forest’s monsters.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE SECLUDED FOREST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THE SECLUDED FOREST

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE SECLUDED FOREST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: It’s clear to Rook after traveling for a short distance that they’ve traveled far past the edge of civilization.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THE SECLUDED FOREST
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After pausing to study the map, Shayliss realizes they’re being followed by something dangerous, and suggests that the group prepare for a battle. They’ve been followed.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THEN LEAVE US BOTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: THEN LEAVE US BOTH

Sparknotes.TITLE: THEN LEAVE US BOTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zafir refuses to abandon Echo, and swears he’ll go and defend her no matter the cost.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THEN LEAVE US BOTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale surprises her friends by insisting that they will help save Echo. She’s going to keep her word no matter what.

Sparknotes.TITLE: THEN LEAVE US BOTH
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale joins Zafir to fight, forcing everyone to follow.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (INDOOR)

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric wakes on the cold ground, surrounded by the broken wreckage of the coffin. Nightingale is there to help him to his feet, and explain what was happening to him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric shares a strange memory he experienced as the coffin died, that he suspects it shared with him by accident. The bloody trail they saw earlier is the key to finding Justice, they should follow it right away.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Padric is no longer Unselectable.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (OUTDOOR)

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Padric wakes outside, climbing from the coffin. Nightingale helps him to his feet, and tries to comfort him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group catches him up on how they got outside, and explain how the coffin was feeding on him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TOO GOOD TO BE TRUE (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Padric is no longer Unselectable.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TREASON AVOIDED (INDOOR)

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi wakes up on the floor of the dungeon, laying near the broken wreckage of the coffin. Nightingale is there to comfort her, and explain that she was just fed on by a parasite, that she didn’t see anything real.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group catches her up on what happened, and Remi shares some wisdom she gained. As the coffin was destroyed, she experienced its memories. The bloody trail they saw is the key to finding Justice, they need to follow it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (INDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Remi is no longer Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TREASON AVOIDED (OUTDOOR)

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi wakes up outside, and Nightingale is there to tell her that nothing she saw was real. It was all a product of the coffin feeding on her life-force.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group catches her up on their escape, and how they ended up outside.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Remi doesn’t want to share the details of what she saw, though she’s determined not to allow her vision to come to pass.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TREASON AVOIDED (OUTDOOR)
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Remi is no longer Unselectable

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWICE THE SOULS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TWICE THE SOULS

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWICE THE SOULS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After trudging through the Eerie for what feels like forever, the Shadow Lord appears to the group. It promises the location of their missing friend, insisting that she’s about to die unless they do something to prevent it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWICE THE SOULS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss urges everyone to ignore the information, that the Shadow Lord is probably leading them into a trap.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWICE THE SOULS
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Pardic argues that it doesn’t matter. The chance they might actually find Justice can’t be ignored.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWILIGHT MOTEL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: TWILIGHT MOTEL

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWILIGHT MOTEL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: While trapped inside the coffin, Nightingale dreams of her life before Middara, when she helped her parents run their cheap motel. At first her vision seems normal, but soon she’s tormented with many of the horrors she has seen in Middara.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWILIGHT MOTEL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She discovers the Maluma is also within, being tortured. Its greatest desire is to remain on Middara, and not be forced to return to the place it came from.

Sparknotes.TITLE: TWILIGHT MOTEL
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Coffin Buddy

Sparknotes.TITLE: VISAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: VISAGE

Sparknotes.TITLE: VISAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord finally falls before them, deflating away to a pale wisp of energy.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VISAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Zeke rushes over to Justice, reviving her as quickly as he can. He explains that they’ve defeated the Shadow Lord, and it’s time to go. They’ve come to rescue her at last.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VISAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She’s confused, unable to believe that they could’ve killed it. Wasn’t it supposed to be a god? She insists that it isn’t dead, and hints at the horrible things that happened while she was a prisoner.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VISAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord rises before their eyes, reforming from smoke. Instead of angry, it seems impressed with their dedication, explaining that no weapon made by mortals could kill it. The corpses all around the room began to rise, picking up every weapon they can reach.

Sparknotes.TITLE: VISAGE
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Shadow Lord is amused with their efforts. It says that there’s enough death elsewhere, and they’ve earned their freedom for now, if they leave.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WARN US NEXT TIME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WARN US NEXT TIME

Sparknotes.TITLE: WARN US NEXT TIME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale chides the pixies for not warning them of the danger, but they’re unrepentant, insisting that it’s not their fault the Butcher woke up.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WARN US NEXT TIME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They follow a little further through the Eerie.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WARN US NEXT TIME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma tries to get Nightingale to turn back, warning of danger ahead, but again she ignores it.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WARN US NEXT TIME
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The group comes upon a massive treasure room, filled with mountains of gold and enchanted objects. At the center of it all is a huge wooden coffin, almost completely buried in gold.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: After being beaten by the forest’s overwhelming creatures, the group is forced to stumble away, forced to find an alternate route through the forest.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss discovers Nightingale has been deeply injured during the battle, and is now unable to fight. Shayliss does her best to give her first aid, but there’s no time to stop and turn around yet.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook offers to carry her, but Nightingale refuses, insisting that she can at least hobble along with the group

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Nightingale is Injured

Sparknotes.TITLE: WE HAVE TO KEEP MOVING
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: Massacred

Sparknotes.TITLE: WEIRD GLOW
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WEIRD GLOW

Sparknotes.TITLE: WEIRD GLOW
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They stop at a fork, unsure of which way to go. Rook points to Zeke’s bag, where something is glowing from within. He removes it to discover the strange Goblet Lakshmi gave him.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WEIRD GLOW
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The chalice is glowing powerfully, and Zeke believes it is leading to Justice. Shayliss disagrees, and ignores its directions.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT WILL YOU DO NOW?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WHAT WILL YOU DO NOW?

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT WILL YOU DO NOW?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Ezra and Brea finally take their leave of the party. They explain that the Anointed need to know what happened to Zafir, and they need to help stop Charon.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT WILL YOU DO NOW?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: They promise that the Anointed won’t be sent to hunt Nightingale.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT WILL YOU DO NOW?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: She wants to know if they think Charon is real. They confirm that he is, but that there are other dangers. The rest of the Council of Abhorrence are still free.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT WILL YOU DO NOW?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Special: Ezra and Brea leave the party

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S ANOTHER MONSTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WHAT’S ANOTHER MONSTER

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S ANOTHER MONSTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Shayliss is horrified at the idea of helping it escape, furious at the damage they’ve already done. In her mind, if they help then any harm it causes will be their fault.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S ANOTHER MONSTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Rook agrees, but for more practical reasons, arguing they can find their own way to Justice faster than escorting the coffin to the surface first. In the end, the party calls a vote.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S ANOTHER MONSTER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Decision: Help the Coffin escape the Eerie, or leave it to find its own way out.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Abigail wants to know where the rest of the party will go. Nightingale says that she’ll absolutely be part of the group that goes to replace the Aegis stone. She refuses any suggestion that she should go anywhere else, or stay behind.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma manifests for her alone, surprisingly polite. After Shayliss notices Nightingale’s distress, it appears for everyone. The guards react, but they’re powerless to stop it just like the rest of them.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma admits that it was wrong about Nightingale’s weakness and incompetence. It admits that she’s resisted longer than any host it ever had. It says that it has no ultimate loyalty to Charon, and served him because he promised a body.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: It proposes that Nightingale could provide it the same thing: if they give it a body, it will leave Nightingale voluntarily. In the process it confirms the truth of the Anointed’s story, about Charon’s imprisonment in the Suspended Tomb. In exchange for a body, it can also provide Nightingale the location of the last Pontifex piece.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Nightingale agrees instantly, prompting shock and horror from the rest of the group. She breaks down in front of them, confessing how difficult it has been to hold out for so long, how the Maluma has been wearing down on her sanity.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The promise struck, the Maluma admits that the last piece of the pontifex was what it was looking for when they first met: it is stored beneath the White Spires, in the keeping of Vault Lord Hogrifar.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: The Maluma agrees to stop trying to take Nightingale’s body in the meantime, while she’s working to honor the bargain. If she ever defies it, it will turn on her again.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHAT’S WRONG WITH HER
Sparknotes.CONTENT: ! Flag Check: A New Owner

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHO ARE YOU?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: WHO ARE YOU?

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHO ARE YOU?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Effie Grand appears in the throne room. After initially being dismissed, Zeke insists that she’s the perfect person for the job. They’re already going to the passage, and her ship takes it all the time.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHO ARE YOU?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Tyrial asks what she wants in payment, and she takes her card back from Zeke, showing off the ship. If she succeeds, she wants an entire airship as payment.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHO ARE YOU?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Considering how desperate they are, and how unlikely success appears, Tyrial agrees.

Sparknotes.TITLE: WHO ARE YOU?
Sparknotes.CONTENT: Tyrial and Abigail say their farewells.
